session_synopses.Butcher: This dialog is started by talking to the Butcher character in the Colony. The player may ask the Butcher questions or recruit them as a temporary follower inside the Colony. Alternatively, this dialog runs through a flag in case the player has already met the Butcher, or if the Butcher was recruited as a follower. The Butcher sounds eerily vacant unless otherwise specified, his mind destroyed by his time in Colony.

PAD_DefeatedKetheric.speaker: Player
PAD_DefeatedKetheric.text: An elder brain... That was the Heart of the Absolute?
PAD_DefeatedKetheric.context: NodeContext: Almost to self, processing this information

AD_MistressOfSouls_Combat.speaker: Kressa Bonedaughter
AD_MistressOfSouls_Combat.text: Not even the worms will want your carcass once I'm done with you!

AD_SkullLasher_001_Combat.speaker: Hairy Henry
AD_SkullLasher_001_Combat.text: You will beg for death long before we grant it!

MistressOfSouls_InterruptBlessing.speaker: Kressa Bonedaughter
MistressOfSouls_InterruptBlessing.text: Halt. Who are you, pretty dead thing, that interrupts this consecration of the undying?

MistressOfSouls_InterruptBlessing.speaker: Kressa Bonedaughter
MistressOfSouls_InterruptBlessing.text: Halt. Who are you, warm of blood and quick of heart, that interrupts this consecration of the undying?

MistressOfSouls_InterruptBlessing.speaker: Player
MistressOfSouls_InterruptBlessing.text: I am unworthy of your notice - a nobody.

MistressOfSouls_InterruptBlessing.speaker: Kressa Bonedaughter
MistressOfSouls_InterruptBlessing.text: Tsk. A defective thrall that should have had its tongue removed.

MistressOfSouls_InterruptBlessing.speaker: Kressa Bonedaughter
MistressOfSouls_InterruptBlessing.text: We are preparing to leave. Make yourself useful below.

session_synopses.AD_MistressOfSouls_Combat: Krustine, Mistress of Souls in the Colony Barracks, combat AD. Played only once.
session_synopses.AD_SkullLasher_001_Combat: Hairy Henry, one of three Skull Lashers in the Colony Barracks, combat AD. Played only once.
session_synopses.MistressOfSouls_InterruptBlessing: Reaction to interrupting Krustine's blessing ceremony in the Colony Barracks. She is blessing three Skull Lashers, and approaching or interrupting will cause her to interrogate you.

AD_MizoraInPod.text: Bastards. Can't conjure so much as a fireball in this thing.

session_synopses.AD_MizoraInPod: Mizora in a pod in COLony

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: So much blood. The illithids take what's useful and discard the rest.

session_synopses.PAD: The player reacts to the view of the Oubliette's bloodbath aquarium from inside the Colony kitchen.

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.text: *Desperation... pain... terror. Cultists raided his village - he was the sole survivor.*

AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer.text: *The device does not react to your presence.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *You remember the shattered windows of Elturel's High Cathedral, the burning black sky of Avernus beyond.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *In its horror, the Blood War unites you. Tiefling, dwarf and elf alike huddle behind the shields of your paladin order, waiting for salvation. But when it comes... disunity.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *The returned city casts your people out, the devils who dragged them down to hell. In the end, it is not your paladin oath that is broken: it is your faith itself.*

Pods.speaker: Narrator
Pods.text: *You connect to the device, and gain control of the pods - and the fate of their occupants.*

Pods.speaker: Narrator
Pods.text: *The device is open to your tadpole's command - to your authority.*

PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole.speaker: Player
PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole.text: An unusual parasite, here. It's - it's reaching out to me.

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.text: *Courage... conviction... defiance. Even as her organs began to dissolve, she believed she could resist.*

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.text: *Delirium... mania... laughter. His mind broke before the end, and he was laughing uncontrollably as the skin fell from his face.*

DaisyAD_BrinePool.text: Brine pools... but empty of tadpoles. Unusual. Harvesting all the larvae indicates they are getting ready for something big.

AD_Zevlor_Pod.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Zevlor_Pod.context: NodeContext: Recalling when the ambush went wrong - his people started to fight and die

PAD_MizoraPodComment.speaker: Player
PAD_MizoraPodComment.text: That pod - is that Mizora inside?

AD_Minthara_EnteredTadpolingCenter.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredTadpolingCenter.text: This place has been used to make slaves of those who should be masters.

DaisyAD_PodsComment.text: Mind flayers and civilians side by side...
This must be where they infect and transform those they kidnap.

AD_MemoryImprint_002_Manip.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_002_Manip.text: *This pod pulsates with the angry memories of Ravengard's search officer, Manip Shuurga. She laments her failure to locate him.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.text: *Though the pod is empty, traces of psychic energy still linger around it, and memories of its former inhabitant spill into your mind.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.text: *You see the streets of Baldur's Gate... the emblem of the Flaming Fist... martial drills and courtly dances.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.text: *You feel the courage of a soldier who became a commander, and the intelligence of a commander who became a Duke.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.text: *Ravengard was here, in this pod, not long ago.*

DarkUrgePod.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod.text: *This pod has a different air to its chitinous cavern. Dust and dirt are gathered on the inside.*

DarkUrgePod.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod.text: *It's broken beyond repair. Seemingly by a blunt impact, as if whoever was inside threw themselves against it in an effort to break out.*
DarkUrgePod.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge bends down next to the pod, to look into the area beyond the glass, it doesn't have to be shown

DarkUrgePod.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod.text: *Your brain hurls an image towards you. Your own head-blood gushing down in front of your eyes.*

DarkUrgePod.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod.text: *You were in the pod a long, long while, but it seems you have no recollection of ever entering the nautiloid.*

session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer: AD for a memory imprint on an empty pod in the Tadpoling Centre.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor: AD for Zevlor's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before he was imprisoned here.
session_synopses.Pods: Interacting with the mind flayer device in the Tadpoling Centre that controls the pods inside. You get to choose whether to free or purge the occupants of the pods - mind flayers and innocents alike.
session_synopses.PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole: The party reacts to spotting a special tadpole in one of the brine pools of the Colony Tadpoling Centre. It can be used for the tadpole powers tree.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_BrinePool: Brine pools. But theyâ€™ve been harvested. They should be full of tadpoles.
session_synopses.AD_Zevlor_Pod: Repeated ADs from Zevlor, while he is (alive) inside one of the Colony's Tadpoling Centre pods. He is a bit dazed, mumbling about the events that lead up to his capture, mixed with traumatic memories of Elturel, Avernus, and his exile from his paladin order.
session_synopses.PAD_MizoraPodComment: Players comment when approaching Mizora's pod in the back of the Tadpoling Centre, provided she is there.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_PodsComment: Daisy AD when inside the Colony Tadpoling Centre. Daisy remarks on the occupants of the pods in the room (it is possible that all innocent occupants died before this point and there are only mind flayers in the pods). The Tadpoling Centre is where prisoners are transformed into mind flayers.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_002_Manip: AD for Shuurga's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before she was imprisoned here.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard: AD for an empty pod's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from Duke Ravengard, who was imprisoned here before.
session_synopses.DarkUrgePod: A player character interacts with a pod in the Tadpoling Centre that once belonged to the Dark Urge character. Other player characters may also investigate the pod, and imply something about who the pod belonged to if they succeed a skill check.

AD_Us_FollowPlayer.speaker: Us
AD_Us_FollowPlayer.text: We must flee - lead Us to safety, friend.

AD_Butcher_CombatTurn001.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_CombatTurn001.text: Head full of red. No want chop. Make it stop. Make me stop.
AD_Butcher_CombatTurn001.context: NodeContext: Anguished moment of lucidity mid-combat, begging the player to free him (kill him) even while possessed to attack.

AD_Butcher_Idle.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_Idle.text: Pretty faces go chop... faces? No - no faces, only meat. Never think, never stop. Only chop. Chop. CHOP.
AD_Butcher_Idle.context: NodeContext: Brief note of lucidity on '...faces?' as he seems momentarily aware of his condition - then shakes it off and returns to his work rhythm a little more forcefully.

Us.speaker: Us
Us.context: NodeContext: Recognition/excited ('helm' referencing their previous adventures to get to a nautiloid helm during the tutorial)

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: We remember you well. You saved Us once. Perhaps you can do it again?

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: They are not kind to Us here. We are different, they say. Aberrant.

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: They wish to repurpose Us - destroy what they cannot fix. Please, help Us escape harm!

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: Oh, thank you, thank you! You are a good friend - no, more. Rescuer.

session_synopses.AD_Us_FollowPlayer: This AD plays upon freeing Us from its cage in the Colony Morgue, without triggering a crime reaction from Chop, the Colony Butcher. In that case, Us will start following the first player they see (or the player that got them out) and request to get out of the Morgue and to safety.
session_synopses.AD_Butcher_CombatTurn001: This AD plays during combat with Chop, the Colony Butcher. Chop will fight you because he is enthralled, but has a secret desire to be put out of his misery.
session_synopses.AD_Butcher_Idle: Sequential, repeated AD for Chop, the Colony butcher. He will say a line every few seconds while in his idle behaviour. Chop is generally enjoying his job, but something deep beneath his enthralled exterior realizes the horror of his reality. Some of these lines could be considered a little bit song-like - Chop would be humming to himself while working.
session_synopses.Us: Default dialogue with Us while they are in the Colony. Us is either locked in a cage in the Morgue, trying to sneak away from the Butcher, or thanking you for saving them, after which they will disappear.

PAD_BrinePool.speaker: Player
PAD_BrinePool.text: No tadpoles in this brine pool.

session_synopses.PAD_BrinePool: A PAD reacting to the brine pool in the Tadpoling Centre in the Colony. The player will interact with the brine pool and play this dialog. If a player succeeds a perception check and fishes out the last remaining tadpole, a different node will be played.

Memory_TutorialDark.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TutorialDark.text:
Oh, my darling Carolina
how I'd love to wine and dine ya
but you chose my foolish brother over me...
Memory_TutorialDark.context: NodeContext: singing (Note: the writer, Sarah Baylus, says in the Jira thread that she will pass the melody for the voice talent to follow)

Memory_TutorialDark.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TutorialDark.text:
And when you two are wed
Well, my heart will be but dead
For my sister you will sadly, surely be.

Memory_TutorialDark.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TutorialDark.text:
But my brother, he's a loser
And I take you for a chooser
So perhaps one day you'll leave him high and dry.

Memory_TutorialDark.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_TutorialDark.text:
And if you choose another
What's more loving than a brother
Yes, a stand-up, homely, gentle sort of guy.

session_synopses.Memory_TutorialDark: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader" depicts victim singing a sad folk song. This is one of the brain jars that can be found in the tutorial area of the game.

AD_Phase3Transition.text: UNLIFE TO MY LIFE - SUSTAIN ME, SLAVES.

AD_NightsongApostle.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongApostle.text: Now you wear a face to match your soul, oathbreaker.
AD_NightsongApostle.context: NodeContext: Scorn in the heat of battle - her nemesis has just turned into a hideous monster

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: There you are. As predicted. What is it, I wonder, that draws one toward death like a moth to light?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: You could have run away. Absconded with the Prism - the one thing that could prevent me from fulfilling my destiny.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: But the lure of one's destiny is irresistible, isn't it?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: Perhaps you hoped to learn your place in history before you are erased from it. A bright flash of clarity before the snuffing-out.

KethericIntro.speaker: Player
KethericIntro.text: Why is the Prism so important to you?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: The very fact of your being attests to its power - despite your infection, you resisted the brain, here in the heart of its domain.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: What good is an army of thralls if they do not obey their master?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: My Lord Myrkul gave me the one thing I desired - the one thing that no other god could grant me.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: My daughter's life returned. Her heart beating once more.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: For that, he asked that I serve as his Chosen, join Orin and Gortash to grow the cult of the Absolute, and then... take control of it.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: He's never had a more devoted follower.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: I have fought great wars before, in the service of other gods, and other powers. But for Myrkul, I would condemn all of FaerÃ»n to death.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: You are all that stands between me and my destiny - and you have brought the Prism here.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: I will kill you now. And then I will raise you as my servant.

PAD_AfterCombatComment.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCombatComment.text: The Chosen of Myrkul is dead - permanently, this time.
PAD_AfterCombatComment.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's distracted. More focused on Gortash.

DaisyAD_ElderBrain.text: An elder brain... One of the cruellest and most powerful creatures in existence, enslaved by mere mortals.

AD_KethericInvulnerable.text: Have you not learned? I am beyond death, fool.

DaisyAD_GrabNetherstone.text: Ketheric's Netherstone - it's in his armour. Take it.

session_synopses.AD_Phase3Transition: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the third phase of the fight starts, this will play only once on Ketheric when his turn starts. Ketheric, in his Apostle of Myrkul form, calls upon the Necromites to sacrifice themselves to heal him.
session_synopses.AD_NightsongApostle: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, after Ketheric has transformed into his Apostle form/reached his second stage, Nightsong will react to this upon her first combat turn after this.
session_synopses.KethericIntro: This dialog plays at the start of the Ketheric boss fight in the Colony. There are numerous permutations here: Nightsong being dead or alive, freed from her soul cage (through stealth before being spotted); Isobel being absent or tadpoled or tadpoled and killed (in the boss chamber) before entering the dialog; Jaheira being present here (and spotted) or being absent.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterCombatComment: A PAD commenting on defeating Ketheric in his Apostle form at the end of the mind flayer Colony. After this the player will say that they need to go discuss the next course of action with their allies (alluding to Intermezzo in Moonrise Tower).At this point the players should take Ketheric's Netherstone (but we can't ensure that a player hasn't already looted said netherstone off his corpse by the time that end node is played).If there are two players available, they will banter together, otherwise a solo PAD will play.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_ElderBrain: The Elder Brain. One of the cruelest and most powerful creatures that exist. Subservient to those three. And those gems seem to be the key. We must obtain them.
session_synopses.AD_NightsongFreed_Apostle: Ketheric comments on Nightsong being freed from her soul cage in the Colony, after the combat has already started, in his Apostle form. This means Ketheric will have been convinced to relent, and has been transformed into his Apostle form before Nightsong is freed from her soul cage.
session_synopses.AD_KethericInvulnerable: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the player tries to damage Ketheric while he is invulnerable (Nightsong is still in the soul cage). Ketheric will react to the damage attempt. This will play if Ketheric is in his human form.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_GrabNetherstone: After the fight with Ketheric, Daisy asks us to grab Ketheric's Netherstone.

Puzzle.speaker: Narrator
Puzzle.text: *As the console bursts into life, a mind touches your own. Alien and full of desperate need - but fragmented, too.*
Puzzle.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of puzzle space as it winks into existence

Puzzle.speaker: Narrator
Puzzle.text: *It is... incomplete. It yearns to connect - but needs you to guide the process, linking each part of your mind to its like.*
Puzzle.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the starting point of the player's mind, and the ending point of the machine's, with all the unconnected paths in between.

PAD_GrandDesign.speaker: Gale
PAD_GrandDesign.text: I wonder, how did the Illithid Empire fall?

PAD_GrandDesign.speaker: Karlach, Lae'zel, Shadowheart
PAD_GrandDesign.text: Probably with a great gooey bang.

PAD_PuzzleSolved.speaker: Player
PAD_PuzzleSolved.text: That should do it. Time to see what's back there.

session_synopses.Puzzle: This dialog plays when interacting with the button at the Colony Vault. It is an interaction with the mind within the illithid machine. Only companions with a tadpole may interact with the machine, or they will be denied access.Interacting with the mind allows the player to start solving the puzzle, reset the puzzle or talk to it after the puzzle is solved. When it is solved, the mind considers you its master, and you can ask it to do things like open or close the vaults (which contain rewards), show you a map of the Colony or "shatter" the mind to its original state.
session_synopses.PAD_PuzzleSolved: The party reacts to solving the mind flayer "mind puzzle" in the Colony Vault, near the Necro-Lab. Solving the puzzle unlocks a door where you can find the rewards.

session_synopses.AD_Rapid06: Quick-fire Elder Brain ADs in the Colony corridors. If the party attacked Ketheric on the Moonrise Rooftop, there will be more frantic, fast-paced ADs from the Elder Brain surrounding us in quick succession, similar to when we approach the Elder Brain in the Morphic Pool. In this flow, the evacuation of the Colony is a lot more pressing because Ketheric was attacked.
session_synopses.AD_Whispers: While walking through Colony, the Elder Brain will whisper to you. The whispers are cued at specific triggers around the Colony, and will play only once. This AD can play anywhere in the Colony, except the Ketheric Showdown chamber and the hallway approaching it.Consider these ADs like a psychic intercom, the Elder Brain communicating with minions inside the Colony (thralls, illithids and Myrkulites alike). Most of the time, it will use its "Voice of the Absolute" to issue commands or rile up the troops, but sometimes the illithid side of the Elder Brain will slip through the cracks and address you, the player, directly, asking you to come and save it from the dominion of the Chosen Three.This AD is repeated on a timer, and will select the next available branch in sequence. The Logical Names of the greeting nodes refer to the areas in which these flags can be triggered, those areas being UPPER (upper floor)/LOWER (lower floor)/NEARBY (near the Ketheric Showdown chamber). ANY nodes can always be selected in any area.To only see a certain branch in the appropriate area, use the InArea flags, but make sure to add an additional greeting node without InArea flags that jumps to the next greeting node in the sequence, to prevent the AD sequence from getting stuck. Note that NEARBY and LOWER can overlap, so if you want something for lower only, make sure that InArea_Nearby is unchecked.The sequential selection of nodes is done using local flags and binary combinations of those flags.Any controlled player will be randomly selected for this AD, if they are available for dialog.These ADs play in random locations around the player upon whom the AD is played (use the COL_ElderBrainADs_Event_TeleportSpeaker flag on the upcoming speaker in a logic node for this, except for the greeting node).

PAD_BloodShower.speaker: Player
PAD_BloodShower.context:
NodeContext: Lae'zel line: sarcastic.
KAralch: Disgust

session_synopses.PAD_BloodShower: A player reacts to getting splattered in blood and guts when they are standing below the corpse chute of the Colony Cleansing Room, when it is opened up. On the first time, a corpse will come falling out, but afterwards the chute simply serves as a blood shower at the press of the button.

PAD_SourcePain.speaker: Player
PAD_SourcePain.text: Argh! I feel... lighter, somehow. Like something's been taken.

session_synopses.PAD_SourcePain: This PAD plays when a player is used as an energy source in one of the Colony's regeneration stations.

PAD_MolEyepatch.speaker: Player
PAD_MolEyepatch.text: This is Mol's eyepatch - what's become of her?

DaisyAD_Balthazar.text: The necromancer was experimenting on the tadpoles.
But they were already imbued with Netherese magic - so where did that magic come from?

session_synopses.PAD_MolEyepatch: The players may come across Mol's discarded eyepatch in the Necromancer Chamber in the Upper Colony. They will react to it appropriately, depending on whether they ever met Mol or not.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_Balthazar: On arrival in colony. On encountering Balthazar in room. The necromancer did experiments on the tadpoles here. We know they are magically manipulated. But how?

session_synopses.ResonanceStone_PAD: The players react to gaining or losing the "Eldritch Pleasure" status effect from the Resonance Stone in the secret sideroom of the Colony kitchen/dissection room. This status is applied or removed upon gaining the "Eldritch Pleasure" buff bestowed by the aura effect of the Resonance Stone, and will only play once per user and nearby player. The removal dialog will only trigger upon losing the buff while inside a trigger near the Colony kitchen, as to avoid it playing unexpectedly during later parts of the game.

PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.text: Of all the beastly lairs I've had to poke my nose into - an illithid colony is still by far the worst.
PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.context: InternalNodeContext:  Referencing Bhaalspawn/Abdel (Unsure if it's a canon adventure? Might be)

PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.speaker: Player
PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.text: I think we have more pressing concerns than a trip down memory lane.

session_synopses.PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn: Jaheira comments about returning to a mindflayer colony, which Laez'al, Wyll and Astarion comment on. It's mentioned that this is Jaheira reflecting on coming to one of these with Abdel Adrian,

PAD_ElevatorBanter.speaker: Player
PAD_ElevatorBanter.text: Is anyone else's tadpole squirming around a lot more than usual?

PAD_ElevatorBanter.speaker: Player
PAD_ElevatorBanter.text: Aye. Feels like something down here has them excited... or scared.

session_synopses.PAD_ElevatorBanter: A banter PAD when taking the elevator down to the Ketheric Showdown from the upper floor of the Colony. If there are two tadpoled players available, they will banter together, otherwise a solo PAD will play.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: I will never tire of sitting on dead men's thrones.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: seated on Ketheric's throne in a casual pose, looking very pleased with herself

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: And I'll never tire of killing their previous occupants. We make a good team.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: We make an acceptable team. But there are greater challenges than Ketheric ahead of us.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: It is clear, now, that he was not working alone.

node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaves throne, standing from here on

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: During my time in the cult, I came to know one of his co-conspirators all too well - Bhaal's blood-letter, Orin.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: I know one of them all too well - Bhaal's blood-letter, Orin.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: To think I thought her to be speaking for the Absolute. I worshipped that woman.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: An old flame?

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Jealous? You needn't be -  when Orin is in my hands, her agony will nourish me.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: She is the iblith who indoctrinated me with the Absolute's lies.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Indeed, she is the one who indoctrinated me with the Absolute's lies.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You committed atrocities in the name of those lies.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: And for that I am sorry. I will commit all future atrocities for my own gain - and yours, should we stand together.

session_synopses: After the SCE debrief, Minthara sits on Ketheric's throne and dreams of what lies ahead.

NimbleAndNickels.speaker: Nimble
NimbleAndNickels.text: Where did I leave that damn hammer?

NimbleAndNickels.speaker: Nickels
NimbleAndNickels.text: The stone says it is one floor down to the left.

NimbleAndNickels.speaker: Nimble
NimbleAndNickels.text: Hah - thanks Nickels. And the stone.

Nimble.speaker: Nimble
Nimble.text: Wulbren will get us to the city - I know it.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Mol is gonna be waiting for us at the gates of the city - I know it.

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: It's finally time for the Ironhand Gnomes to come home.
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: eager, excited to return to the city

Alfira.speaker: Alfira
Alfira.text: I hope the kids liked it...

session_synopses.NimbleAndNickels: Back and forth between nimble and nickels in the tower.
session_synopses.Nimble: Nimble is in moonrise towers, preparing to leave for the city. In the top set of nodes wulbren is dead, and she is feeling lost and sad. In the bottom, wulbren is alive (nickels is dead) and she is doing her best to get organised, while fighting her grief over the loss of her friend.
session_synopses.Ide: Ide is worried about Mol. In the top set of ADs, the player has shown Ide Mol's eyepatch - hinting that she might be dead. She's in stern denial about the possibility. In the bottom set, she's looking around anxiously, waiting for her leader.
session_synopses.Wulbren: These ADs occur in the epilogue. In one set, Wulbren is admiring the stonework in front of him, and contemplating the artistry of Moonrise Towers. In the other, it's his idle behaviour as he prepares to leave for Baldur's Gate - excited for his plans to all come together.
session_synopses.Alfira: This AD occurs in the epilogue of Act 2, as Alfira is keeping an eye on the kids. Mol is missing and they're really worried. She muses about she can do to cheer them up/is riding a high after performing with the player in the hopes of cheering the kids up.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I found Mol's eyepatch.

node_data.speaker: Umi
node_data.text: What? Where is she?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Rising tearful panic

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Dead - like you'll be soon, you little runt.

node_data.speaker: Umi
node_data.text: No! No! Don't say that! Don't!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Goes to pieces; floods of tears at the player's meanness

session_synopses: Umi is upset by Mol's absence and is just barely holding it together (despite Alfira's best attempts).

Debrief.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief.text: Our enemies spread like rub-rot - treat one patch, and two more bloom in its place.

Debrief.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief.text: An elder brain, bound by lost Netherese magic, with servants of the Dead Three holding the chain.
Debrief.context: NodeContext: Casually ticking off world-ending threats on her fingers

Debrief.speaker: Player
Debrief.text: You almost seem like you're enjoying yourself.

Debrief.speaker: Player
Debrief.text: I'm having the time of my life.

Debrief.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief.text: It is good to savour the moment of victory - but pace yourself. Our fight is just beginning.

session_synopses.Debrief: In the aftermath of the battle in the colony, Jaheira reflects on next steps and officially asks to join our party.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: You did it. I knew you would.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little wistful

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It's not over yet. A nautiloid is on its way to Baldur's Gate.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: Gods. One day, you go to sleep and everything's square. Then you wake up, and it's a dodecahedron. With tentacles.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: There's much I'd like to discuss with you, actually. Perhaps I could join you in your camp later?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Why wait?

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: To be perfectly frank, I'm exhausted. It feels a bit as though I've been dropped into another dimension.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: A little time to rest and reflect, and I'll be ready to go at it anew. What say you?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I don't think so.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: Pity. But I suppose you have your path, and I have mine. Perhaps they'll meet again. I won't rue the day.

session_synopses: The player has an opportunity to catch up with Isobel if she survived Act 2, but Nightsong died

Debrief.speaker: Withers
Debrief.text: The shadows yet fester. The Dead Three, united under cover of darkness. The balance shifts.

Debrief.speaker: Narrator
Debrief.text: *The Dead Three. Myrkul, Bane, and Bhaal - lords of deathly tenets, and traitors to Ao, god of gods.*

Debrief.speaker: Narrator
Debrief.text: *All three sowed chaos at the height of their power. And all three now walk the planes as mortals - or so it's believed.*

Debrief.speaker: Withers
Debrief.text: There are depths to this alliance yet unplumbed. Consider, mortal:

Debrief.speaker: Player
Debrief.text: Forget that. Who are you? What are you doing here?

Debrief.speaker: Withers
Debrief.text: I shall ask yet again. Do illithids possess souls?

session_synopses.Debrief: Jergal's debrief at MOO after the mind flayer colony.

DaisyJournalBegin.text: We leave the heart of the Absolute, alive, thanks to you.
You did well to defeat Ketheric. But Ketheric was only the first to fall.
There are many more battles ahead, and they will not be so easily won. You will need allies.

session_synopses.DaisyJournalBegin: Daisy sets you on the mission to gather allies upon trying to leave SCE. Entire dialogue is telepathic (Daisy does not show up in the world.)

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: You helped me escape this hellspit, then took down the heart of Moonrise - Ketheric himself. I'm impressed.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: And I'm not a man easily impressed.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I believe the words you're looking for are 'thank you'.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: I was getting to that, but all right - thank you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: a touch annoyed

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: Back in my cell, I didn't tell you everything - about who I was, and more importantly, who I represent.
node_data.context: NodeContext: sincere

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: I am Wulbren Bongle, leader of the Ironhand Gnomes. No doubt you've heard of us?
node_data.context: NodeContext: said with immense pride

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recall stories of the Ironhand Gnomes - a talented group of inventors who were banished from Baldur's Gate.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I don't know much, I'm afraid.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: We are inventors of the highest order, matched, perhaps, but never surpassed by the Gondians at the High House of Wonders.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: But our forebears were foolish - complicit with Sarevok's madness over a century past, and so we were banished. Still are to this day.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Pity he never succeeded.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: You agree with such machinations? Duly noted.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: I've fought tooth and nail to restore our reputation. Particularly against Gondian detractors who live in glass houses.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: I've filled appeals - pleaded with the High Artificer himself. They've refused us time and again. Now, however, I will make them listen.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Good luck with that.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: Our cause is just and righteous, friend. That's all the luck we need.
node_data.context: NodeContext: determined and zealous

session_synopses: This dialogue is peak Wulbren. If he's met you in haven (after you saved him), he rolls back on how rude he was as he realises the player would be an amazing asset in the city. If this is your first time meeting him since the escape (if haven is destroyed he waits out on the river until this scene in the epilogue), he realises how good the player would be to have on his side in the city and tells him all about how wronged the ironhand gnomes were.

PAD_UnfinishedBusiness.speaker: Player
PAD_UnfinishedBusiness.text: The road to Baldur's Gate is up ahead. No turning back, once we start down that road.

session_synopses.PAD_UnfinishedBusiness: After the act 2 epilogue, the party comments on resolving unfinished business before moving on to Baldur's Gate/act 3.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: There you are. I was wondering where the devil you'd been.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I was taking a little holiday in the mind flayer colony downstairs.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: That sounds... slimy. But never mind your distasteful predilections. We need to talk about Wulbren.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Who? Oh - right. Well, forget about that magungus. We have more important things to worry about. Like Wulbren.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'muh-GUN-guss' (hard g's).

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What about him?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Wulbren and the Ironhand Gnomes are planning something dreadful in the city.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: They have runepowder. They have motive. We have to stop them.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It seems we'll have our hands full in Baldur's Gate.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: With the sword of justice in one hand and the shield of self-righteousness in the other, we most certainly will.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: To saving the city - and my fool of a friend.

session_synopses: He's a bit mopey but is very much wanting to stick by Wulbren's side despite being mistreated by him. He doesn't know what's happening next but he knows Wulbren has a plan. So that's something.

001.speaker: Flaming Fist
001.text: We need to move. The city's in danger.

AD_ArtAndFlamingFist.speaker: Art Cullagh
AD_ArtAndFlamingFist.text: It's... like... like your mind wants you dead.

AD_ArtAndFlamingFist.speaker: Art Cullagh
AD_ArtAndFlamingFist.text: Thaniel. I had to look after him. Without him, I wouldn't have lasted long.

session_synopses.AD_ArtAndFlamingFist: Art has been cursed for a long time and finally has been freed from the curse. At the epilogue, he will be chatting with another harper about how it felt if he is cured and available.

AD_AngryBrother.speaker: Cal
AD_AngryBrother.text: Rolan's right - I should have done more, I should have saved you.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: ...There's another bottle of Arabellan Dry back there. Put it on the bar, then piss off and leave me alone.
Rolan.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at UmiNodeContext: Slurring slightly, a little bit drunk and irritable - talking to Ide, a tiefling child behind the bar

Rolan.speaker: Ide
Rolan.text: Jaheira said we should serve drinks, but that we shouldn't serve drunks.
Rolan.context: NodeContext: cheerful, playing the part of a bartender - it's a game to him and this is a line he's learned

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Jaheira didn't save your ragged little tail from the cultists - I did.
Rolan.context: NodeContext: venemous - bitter, addressed to Umi

Rolan.speaker: Player
Rolan.text: You saved the kid? Sounds like you deserve a drink.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Oh, it's you. I'd recognise that self-righteous tone anywhere.
Rolan.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at them

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: If you're here to save the day again, you're a little late this time.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Oh, sod off. I'm only here because you 'helped' me and my family.
Rolan.context: NodeContext: Heavy sarcasm on 'helped' - not quite doing airquotes but that's the tone

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: I was ready to cut and run back at the grove, but you had other ideas.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Cal and Lia were taken in by your crap. You convinced them to play hero, and now they're gone.

Rolan.speaker: Player
Rolan.text: Do you know where they are?

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Dead for all I know. Or in the cult's tower with the others who were taken.

Rolan.speaker: Player
Rolan.text: They're better off dead than in the cult's hands.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Bullshit. If they're alive, I can save them.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: You go save the world, or your own arse, or whatever it is you do. I'll fix this.
Rolan.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away, back to the bar when he's done talking

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: exuberant - just returned from a dark place to find your brother Cal, having thought he was lost

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Cal
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: calls out when sees b rother across the room

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: cheeky smile, looking around for sister

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanReturns.text: Cal - answer me. Where is Lia?
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: sees brother's face and fears the worst. Accusatory in worry

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Cal
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: upset, trying not to cry

Hologram.text: Lia, Cal, if you see this... I'm dead. It's nothing to get upset about - it's simply the way life is.
Hologram.context: NodeContext: voice thick with emotion at the thought of never seeing his siblings again, but he's trying to be no nonsense. Doesn't want them to grieve.

Hologram.text: Head to Baldur's Gate immediately. You'll both do excellently there, I have no doubt. And thank you for, well, you know.
Hologram.context: NodeContext: voice thick with emotion at the thought of never seeing his siblings again, but he's trying to be no nonsense. Doesn't want them to grieve.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: If this is about Rolan, go away.
Ide.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking away from player, avoiding eye contactNodeContext: Upset frustrated

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: No need to snap at me.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: ...Sorry. Rolan snapped too and I didn't like it.

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: Rolan isn't very good with kids.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: He isn't very good with anyone. He yelled at me just because I told him not to drink anymore.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: It was for his own good! He can barely stand up straight.
Ide.context: NodeContext: your voice could be mistake for petulance but you're just hurt and frustrated.

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: I get it - you were trying to look after him.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Yeah. He did save us, after all.
Ide.context: NodeContext: Kind of awkward and bashful about it

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Anyway, it's his loss.

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: What do you mean, his loss?

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: I found this book. Old, dusty, full of strange lettering. Pretty sure it's magic.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: I was gonna give it to Rolan so he could learn new spells, you know? Beats drinking 'til he forgets the ones he knows.
Ide.context: NodeContext: a little downcast - you were trying to make a gesture and you feel it's been trodden on

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: Can I have it?

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: It's for Rolan.

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: If you give it to me, I'll make sure he gets it.
True

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Fine. Here, you ... huh, where is it?
Ide.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reaching behind back for the book to find it missing. Looking around - confused. NodeContext: You can't find the book on your person. You're looking around confused.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: I musta dropped it. Well, you can look for it if you want.
Ide.context: NodeContext: Nonchalant - it's not your problem.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Anyway, I'm sick of talking. You can go now. Bye-bye.
Ide.context: NodeContext: Shrug and nonchalant as you end the convo

Reunion.speaker: Rolan
Reunion.text: Where in the Nine Hells have you been?
Reunion.context: NodeContext: frustrated and accusatory - rolan was worried sick but instead of showing it he is being a dick

Reunion.speaker: Lia
Reunion.text: I'm sorry we got captured by murderous lunatics.
Reunion.context: NodeContext: rolan has spoken sharply to her and her temper flares in response - snarky and frustrated

Reunion.speaker: Rolan
Reunion.text: I thought you were dead, you ass. Both of you!
Reunion.context: NodeContext: frustration tinged with upset - getting emotional

Reunion.speaker: Cal
Reunion.text: We're all safe, Rolan - that's what matters.

Reunion.speaker: Rolan
Reunion.text: The beggar wants their coppers, do they? Fine by me.
Reunion.context: NodeContext: being an asshole to the player, snarky and mean

Reunion.speaker: Cal
Reunion.text: Rolan, we're alive because of them - don't be like that.
Reunion.context: NodeContext: nervous, trying to dispel the situation.

Reunion.speaker: Rolan
Reunion.text: Here - take this and leave. You can go now.

AD_SisterWaitingAlone.speaker: Lia
AD_SisterWaitingAlone.text: What would Cal say? Heh. Probably to trust that Rolan knows what he's doing.

AD_SisterWaitingAlone.speaker: Lia
AD_SisterWaitingAlone.text: Cal... what am I going to tell Rolan?

AD_SisterWaitingAlone.speaker: Lia
AD_SisterWaitingAlone.text: 'Our little brother is dead, but hey I'm still here?' Gods.

AD_SiblingsReturn.speaker: Lia
AD_SiblingsReturn.context: NodeContext: calls out to her brother, who is sightly in front of her. Relief

AD_SiblingsReturn.speaker: Rolan
AD_SiblingsReturn.text: Lia? Wretched gods, where have you been? Where's Cal?

AD_SiblingsReturn.speaker: Rolan
AD_SiblingsReturn.text: Lia, answer me. Where is Cal?
AD_SiblingsReturn.context: NodeContext: worried and concern. sees the look on siblings face and fears the worst

Umi.speaker: Umi
Umi.text: The sky looks so pretty with the light. Whoever it is must be good - they must be.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: When you told me about Rolan, I didn't believe you. But it's true...
Brother.context: NodeContext: distant voice, he can't believe what he's just learned

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.context: NodeContext: distant voice, he can't believe what he's just learned

Brother.speaker: Player
Brother.text: He died as he lived - stupidly.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Rolan could be stubborn, but he was never malicious. Not like you.
Brother.context: NodeContext: despite his grief he feels pity for the player.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Everyone I've ever loved is dead. I have nothing.
Brother.context: NodeContext: shellshocked, unable to process what's happened

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.context: NodeContext: he's planning to walk into the cursed darkness to die - alone

AD_BartendingKids.speaker: Umi
AD_BartendingKids.text: Those stupid ghouls - they ruined everything!

AD_BartendingKids.speaker: Ide
AD_BartendingKids.text: It's all right, at least we're safe.

session_synopses.AD_AngryBrother: Lia died in Moonrise. Upon his return to Last Light, Cal and Rolan had a massive argument that the player failed to dispel. Cal, upset, walked away from Rolan and now stands on the balcony. He's upset, grieving, and wishing he had died instead of his sister.
session_synopses.Rolan: Rolan is an apprentice wizard whose siblings were recently captured by cultists. He's stuck in a tavern in the middle of the cursed lands where they were taken, drinking heavily, blaming himself for their loss. When he sees the players, he turns his frustration onto them - he's only here because they convinced him to stay with the other tieflings who were captured in the first place.Rolan is in fact the only reason any of the tieflings are still alive, having protected them from the traitorous Zevlor, who planned to give them over to the cult. He doesn't feel like a hero though - he feels like a failure.
session_synopses.AD_RolanReturns: A one off AD that triggers when the siblings return and spot each other in haven. In this version cal and/or lia are waiting in Last light when rolan returns.
session_synopses.Hologram: Rolan has left a message behind in Haven, for his siblings. This is a small automated hologram that is fixed to the bar counter. It plays a message (that he's gone looking for his siblings or that he's dead) when the player interacts with it.
session_synopses.Ide: Ide mainly talks about the interaction the player can have with Rolan in his dialog (HAV_ProdigyLament_Rolan), where he berates the kid for not giving him more alcohol. This dialog continues that narrative beat, and players can acquire a book Ide was planning to give Rolan.
session_synopses.Reunion: Cal and/or Lia have been rescued from Moonrise towers and reunited with Rolan in Last Light Inn. It is initially a tense scene - Rolan was worried sick/is angry one of his siblings is dead and is taking it out on his family. It is up to the player to calm them down and remind them of what is important - family.
session_synopses.AD_SiblingsReturn: A one off AD that occurs when Lia and/or Cal spot Rolan upon entering Last Light after being rescued from Moonrise.
session_synopses.Umi: Umi is young boy in the Haven. He spends most of his time hunting for valuable items in the Inn. He really looks up to the boss of his crew, Mol. This dialogue covers all his main states in Haven, including isobel and mol's kidnapping, when haven is left unprotected, when it's being attacked etc.
session_synopses.Brother: Cal has been rescued from Moonrise Towers by the player and is now in Last Light. This dialogue covers multiple states: Rolan is missing, Rolan is dead, Rolan and Cal had a fight (player must pass a persuade to calm the fight, pass and fail states here), and a general state for when cal, lia and rolan are all alive and well and cal is grateful to the player.
session_synopses.AD_BartendingKids: Two kids are playing bartender in the bar of an abandoned inn. They're having fun initially, but after an attack on the town they start to get worried and are more downbeat.

AD_Blackboard.speaker: Narrator
AD_Blackboard.text:
*Mug of ale, 4 cp
Chopped cheek, 3 sp
Daily special, inquire*
AD_Blackboard.context:
NodeContext: Reading a menu.
CP = copper piece
SP = silver piece (but for voice just 'sp'  and 'cp' is fine

PAD_MeenlockReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_MeenlockReaction.context: NodeContext: a monster has appeared before you - [prn. Mean-lock]

PAD_MeenlockReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_MeenlockReaction.text: Their eyes are made for the dark - fire and light is our friend.
PAD_MeenlockReaction.context: NodeContext: a monster has appeared before you, trying to warn your fellow player

session_synopses.AD_Blackboard: Comment on the blackboard in Haven
session_synopses.PAD_MeenlockReaction: This fight occurs in the basement of the last light inn. Meenlocks are clawed fey creatures. If the player passes a check they identify them and their most dangerous aspect, otherwise they simply reccognise  what the meenlocks are and realise they are sensitive to light (light spell or torch for instance). If they fail, they can make note of their sharp claws (for instance.)

AD_WeaponSmithReactionToOx.speaker: Dammon
AD_WeaponSmithReactionToOx.text: Just when I think I've seen it all...
AD_WeaponSmithReactionToOx.context: NodeContext: Staring at the dead ochre jelly that was once one of the oxen in the stable.

AD_WeaponSmithReactionToOx.speaker: Dammon
AD_WeaponSmithReactionToOx.context: NodeContext: Resigned acceptance. At leas tthis weird thing is dead, unlike all the other threats to our safety.

session_synopses.AD_WeaponSmithReactionToOx: Dammon comments on the corpse of the devilish ox.

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.text: You're here. You're all right - how?
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: her friend, who she thought was dead, is safe and well. Astonished, grateful

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty.text: We're 'two tiefling queens', remember? I couldn't leave my favourite bard without her partner in crime.
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: alfira thought lakrissa dead - lakrissa is enjoying seeing alfira's face and is being playful and cheeky

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty.text: I did have some help from an old friend though.
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: reference to player, grateful and playful

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: still astonished, trying to figure out how player managed to save lakrissa

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Player
ReunionWithFlirty.text: Killing everyone who got in my way.

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.text: I'm sorry it came to that. But if it was you or them, I'd pick you every time.
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: grateful - knows player had to hurt people to save her friend.

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.text: I never thought I'd see... well, anyone, again.
ReunionWithFlirty.context: InternalNodeContext: NEEDS REWARDNodeContext: Delighted and grateful

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.text: Thank you - a thousand times, thank you. One last favour? Take this off my hands - it suits you better.

session_synopses.ReunionWithFlirty: Lakrissa has been resuced from Moonrise by the player and is reunuined with her closest friend, Alfira.

AD_GnomeAndCat.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_GnomeAndCat.text: Hmm... perhaps a bit more of this...

AD_GnomeAndCat.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_GnomeAndCat.text: Good point. I hadn't thought of that.

Reunion.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion.text: Ah. I'd heard you might be about. How the devil did you get stuck here, Barcus?

Reunion.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion.text: I'm not stuck. I came to find you, of course.
Reunion.context: NodeContext: Faux chagrin but it's really happy to see Wulbren

Reunion.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion.text: Why would you do a foolish thing like that? Really, Barcus.
Reunion.context: NodeContext: 'Really' in kind of sarcastic disbelief that Barcus would annoy him like this.

Reunion.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion.text: Unfortunately for me, you're my friend. Rescuing you from mortal peril is my right.

Reunion.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion.text: But you didn't rescue me, did you? I rescued myself, with the aid of this - helper.
Reunion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wulbren waves a hand dismissively, indicating the player on 'helper'NodeContext: 'Helper' applies to the player. Wulbren is being dismissive of the player's ocntributions to his escape.

Reunion.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion.text: Ah - it's you! I should've guessed. Thank you very much for your help finding Wulbren!

Reunion.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion.text: You don't belong here, Barcus. Soon as the way is clear, pack up and head to Baldur's Gate.

session_synopses.AD_GnomeAndCat: Overhead text of Barcus Wroot casually interacting with His Majesty, the local cat.
session_synopses.Reunion: Barcus runs up to Wulbren in Haven after Wulbren is released from MOO. This is the culmination of everything he's been working for for the whole game and is so excited to see his friend - and find out what the deal wis with the runepowder plot. Barcus is swiftly rebuked by Wulbren and left disappointed but trying to save face.

Combat_FlamingFist_005.speaker: Fist Gretta
Combat_FlamingFist_005.text: I'm going home to Baldur's Gate with your blood on my tunic.

DiscoveredHaven.text: This place is protected. You might find allies here, or at least supplies.

AD_MarcusDefeated.speaker: Isobel
AD_MarcusDefeated.context: NodeContext: hurt and betrayal in her voice. She had to kill a friend who turned traitor.

session_synopses.AD_MarcusDefeated: Marcus is defeated after having betrayed Isobel.

PAD_Moonshield.speaker: Player
PAD_Moonshield.text: No shadows here - something must be keeping it at bay.

TadpoleCheckpoint.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint.context: InternalNodeContext: Marcus transformed, but player counterspelled his summon.

TadpoleCheckpoint.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint.text: Be on the alert, Harpers! We haven't seen the last of Marcus yet.
TadpoleCheckpoint.context: NodeContext: a martial order to her squad, who are shaken by witnessing a hideous transformation

TadpoleCheckpoint.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint.text: As for you - you exposed a True Soul in our midst. You're no puppet of the Absolute, are you?
TadpoleCheckpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: turns to player, speaking more quietlyNodeContext: Looks at us anew. Still suspicious, but intrigued too.

CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) The player takes Orpheus from their pocket and presents it to Jaheira who looks on intrigued. Thereâ€™s a crackle of energy and she reacts to something in her pocket. She takes out the jar again and we see the tadpole flail wildly inside - then the jar explodes and the tadpole drops to the ground dead. There are gasps from the crowd, and several of the Harpers move in to strike us down. |

TadpoleCheckpoint.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint.text: What in the hells is that thing?

TadpoleCheckpoint.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint.text: Tell Jaheira everything you know about the artefact.

TadpoleCheckpoint.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint.text: Congratulations. You've earned yourself the benefit of the doubt.

TadpoleCheckpoint.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint.text: Hear me, Harpers! All clear, at ease!

TadpoleCheckpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) Those Harpers who still had their weapons drawn stow them way. The tension among them dissipates now that Jaheira has cleared us. |

TadpoleCheckpoint.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint.text: I'll not pretend to understand why you, the enigma that you are, suddenly crossed our path, but I'm old and wise enough to recognise a sliver of hope when it crawls out of the dark.

PAD_Halsin.speaker: Halsin
PAD_Halsin.text: Last Light Inn... we rallied here once, years ago, before the assault on Moonrise Towers.
PAD_Halsin.context: NodeContext: Faintly bittersweet reminiscence. Enrtering a place he passed through 100 years ago.

PAD_Halsin.speaker: Halsin
PAD_Halsin.text: The Archdruid at the time spoke to us all, inspiring our courage... he was a fine leader.
PAD_Halsin.context: NodeContext: Wondering how he himself measures up as Archdruid in comparison, perhaps.

session_synopses.PAD_Moonshield: VB played on the first time the players reach the Moonshield on the Haven bridge. They comment on how it holding back the shodows.
session_synopses.TadpoleCheckpoint: The main dialog for the Tadpole Checkpoint event. Triggered either by simply entering Haven, or being caught sneaking inside.Jaheira tests us to see if we carry a tadpole - and must be convinced to let us enter once she discovers we do. Mol and Marcus vouching for the player is aliased across both states of the player being entangled and free from vines.
session_synopses.PAD_Halsin: Voicebark for Halsin on Entering Last Light. He has some history with the place (and the region in general)

PAD_SpottedWrit.speaker: Player
PAD_SpottedWrit.text: What's that sticking out of his pocket?

node_data.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
node_data.text: Please, if you have any idea how to get through to him...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Gently pleading.

node_data.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
node_data.text: If you know how to get through to him, don't hesitate.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Observe his present condition.
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You notice nothing that might indicate a prognosis.*

node_data.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
node_data.text: If you know how to get through to him, don't hesitate.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Pull out the lute you found and play a little.

node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player strums the lute

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: Thaniel! He's still trapped there - he needs help!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: He bolts upright at the sound of the lute. Player puts the lute down on the ground.NodeContext: <GL> rerecord with a sudden snap to awake, He is panicked about Thaniel. Old read was too gradual.
sits bolt upright in bed, shocked and afraid - breathless

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: My lute. You got it back. How?
node_data.context: NodeContext: gathering himself mentally, shocked and almost disbelieving

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I had to slay a monster or two.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: If you can take on monsters, you can help him - you must, please.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: I've been lost in the shadows so long. And I met a boy there too - Thaniel. He's the only reason my mind survived that emptiness, that... loss.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: He told me about someone he knew. Someone called 'Halsin' -  a druid. Thaniel spoke of little else.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: Do you know him?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Depends. Why do you want him?

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: The pull of the darkness, the twisted creatures it manifests - you've seen it, right? Felt it? We can end it. Find Thaniel - Halsin knows how.

session_synopses.PAD_SpottedWrit: Observation on spotting the writ in Art Cullagh's pants. This is needed to direct the player to the House of Healing, which is where they will find his lute.
session_synopses: The player tries to talk to a cursed Flaming Fist, who is currently unable to talk. Fist J'ehlar is presently trying to do the same thing, and responds to the player while trying to keep Cullagh in the loop, i.e. doesn't want to talk over his head and tries to include him in the convo.If the player retrieves his Art's dulcimer and plays it, Cullagh can start to come around and wake up.

EnteringHaven_Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
EnteringHaven_Trespassing.text: *You haven't got permission to remain here; now you'll need to defend yourself.*

session_synopses.EnteringHaven_Trespassing: A player got spotted by an NPC as they were trespassing without Jaheira's premission in Haven.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: |Greeting.|

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: |Isobel answer.|

session_synopses: Nightsong in the Inn after being saved from Shar Temple. Isobel suppose to be somewhere nearby.

PAD_WaveSpawned3.speaker: Player
PAD_WaveSpawned3.text: Gith warriors? Some must have fallen to the curse.

session_synopses.PAD_WaveSpawned3: Commenting on a wave of enemies unleashed against them by the shadow curse (gith warriors this time) as they await Halsin's return from a portal they are protecting.

AD_OutsideSignPost.speaker: Narrator
AD_OutsideSignPost.text: *For a warm bed and full stomach, look no further. Welcome to the Last Light Inn.*
AD_OutsideSignPost.context: NodeContext: a sign for an inn

session_synopses.AD_OutsideSignPost: This signpost is located just outside of the last ligh inn.

Lanceboard_AD.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD.text: This game's awful. Why's anyone play it?
Lanceboard_AD.context: NodeContext: pretending to be bad at the game (she's actually amazing at it)

Lanceboard_AD.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_AD.text: It hones a strategic mind, my dear. Take your turn.

Lanceboard_AD.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD.context: NodeContext: pretending to be bad at the game (she's actually amazing at it)

Raphael.speaker: Raphael
Raphael.text: It's good to see you again. I'd ask if you've made any progress with your little problem, but the tell-tale twitching of your eye is answer enough.
Raphael.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael turns to the player and smiles.

Raphael.speaker: Player
Raphael.text: You again - I'm sure your arrival is simply a coincidence.

Raphael.speaker: Raphael
Raphael.text: My dear, nothing is coincidence. Mortals trifle themselves with free will, as if their betters have not moulded every potential path ahead.

Raphael.speaker: Raphael
Raphael.text: No offence meant, of course. I'm sure everyone in Last Light thinks they could have changed things.

Raphael.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael leans in, pressing in on the player's personal space.

Raphael.speaker: Raphael
Raphael.text: They're not the only ones ripe for temptation, you know. My last contract here fed me for decades.

Raphael.speaker: Player
Raphael.text: You're not responsible for the curse, are you?

Raphael.speaker: Raphael
Raphael.text: Please, I would never leave such a mess behind. Far too much attention for so little gain.

AD_NoticedStolenBoard.speaker: Mol
AD_NoticedStolenBoard.text: Huh. Just put this away a second ago... didn't I?

session_synopses.Lanceboard_AD: ADs for Mol and Raphael as they play lanceboard. Mol is pretending to be unskilled and disinterested in the game.
session_synopses.Raphael: If Mol is dead or not present for other reasons, this solo dialogue for Raphael will take place instead.Rather than sitting at the lanceboard table, he is looming in the corner observing everyone else in Last Light.
session_synopses.AD_NoticedStolenBoard: Mol reacts to the player having stolen and put the lanceboard elsewhere.

Outro.context: InternalNodeContext: Player and Jaheira gather in Haven yard after combat. This node is where Jaheira knows player caused the Shadow Siege by killing/kidnapping Isobel and caused everyone to die in Haven.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: It is abominable that you still live - you who has cost us so much. The murderer of light.
Outro.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) Jaheira eyes us with hatred. Sheâ€™s breathing heavily, exhausted by combat against the shadow creatures. She looks down - but sheâ€™s not out.NodeContext: Shes exhausted from combat, but her hatred of us keeps her standing.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: These dead need not be buried. Beneath this canopy of darkness, all is one yard of restless graves.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: You will lie and rot among them.
Outro.context: NodeContext: Fiery, spat at the player

Outro.speaker: Player
Outro.text: You're weak; exhausted. Walk away while you still can.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: No. To let you live would be beyond cowardice. You sowed these many dead - now I will do the reaping.

session_synopses.Outro: After the battle against the shadows is over, we speak with Jaheira again. Either she hates us because she knows we killed Isobel, or she's contemplative in the aftermath of the battle, and we can have her join our camp.

DismissesHalsin.speaker: Narrator
DismissesHalsin.text: *The Flaming Fist looks past your shoulder; it seems he'd prefer not to speak to you.*

session_synopses.DismissesHalsin: Narrator line for the situation where Halsin tries to talk to Marcus while marcus is waiting to talk to a True Soul

AD_Promenade.speaker: Bex
AD_Promenade.text: This place isn't much, but it's home now I'm here with you.
AD_Promenade.context: NodeContext: Almost apologetic for the run-down place they're staying, but great, warm gladness that Danis is here with her now

AD_Promenade.speaker: Bex
AD_Promenade.context: NodeContext: Sounds like she might be welling up to cry again

AD_Promenade.speaker: Danis
AD_Promenade.text: Please don't start crying again - then I'll cry.
AD_Promenade.context: NodeContext: Comforting (and genuinely worried he might also start crying)

Danis.speaker: Danis
Danis.text: Bex isn't easily offended, so gods know what you said to upset her so much.
Danis.context: NodeContext: If the player really offended Bex earlier, Danis reacts. He's still grateful to the player, but wary now.

Danis.speaker: Danis
Danis.text: After everything you've done for us, she'll come around eventually, I'm sure.

session_synopses.AD_Promenade: Bex and Danis walk around Haven taking in the sights after having been reuinited.
session_synopses.Danis: Danis' dialog in Haven after his rescue.He has made it safely to Haven after escaping Moonrise Towers and has been reunited with Bex, his partner, if she's alive, or is alone if she's not. If she's alive, the player witnessed a really cute reunion between them, and these dialogues cover Danis' followups to that conversation, as well as versions for if he's alone and for a few states in Haven. Not all states are covered since Danis doesn't care much about Ketheric

AD_LoverInspection.speaker: Danis
AD_LoverInspection.text: We have to worry about parasites now? Gods.

FlamingFist_006.speaker: Fist Cyril
FlamingFist_006.text: I'd offer to help, but with Duke Ravengard missing, we can't spare anyone. I'm sorry.
FlamingFist_006.context: CinematicNodeContext: <GL> reshoot, last version had almost no movementInternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: sincere and emotive - you care deeply and are worried for the player's loved ones

AD_BrotherInspection.speaker: Danis
AD_BrotherInspection.text: I would tell you if I had one, I swear it!

AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.speaker: Manip Vidor
AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.text: J'ehlar is doing her best, but he shows no signs of waking.

AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.text: If you have an alternative in mind, please do propose it.

AD_WulbrenInspection.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_WulbrenInspection.text: This is ridiculous - as if I'd let some parasite infect me.
AD_WulbrenInspection.context: NodeContext: Loathing in his voice at the thought

FlirtyTiefling.speaker: Lakrissa
FlirtyTiefling.text: The light - it's happening. Ketheric is about to get a long overdue arse-kicking - I can feel it.

Manip.speaker: Manip Vidor
Manip.text: Heard you're meant to be heading toward the Towers.

Manip.speaker: Manip Vidor
Manip.text: 'A good soldier knows when he isn't the man for the job.' So sayeth Florrick.
Manip.context: NodeContext: With a bit of a bitter edge. He's not super pissed, but isn't happy.

Manip.speaker: Manip Vidor
Manip.text: If you find us a way into the Towers, we'll be there, shield to shield. Until then... we wait.

AD_SisterInspection.speaker: Lia
AD_SisterInspection.text: Can we hurry this up? I need a drink. Now.
AD_SisterInspection.context: NodeContext: annoyed and a little nervous

AD_FlamingFist_003_InCombat.speaker: Fist Rahir
AD_FlamingFist_003_InCombat.context: NodeContext: battle cry - determined and unafraid despite being outnumbered

FlamingFist_001.speaker: Fist Thadwick
FlamingFist_001.text: This is no place for amateurs.
FlamingFist_001.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: now annoyed that player is talking again

AD_Gnome02Inspection.speaker: Nickels
AD_Gnome02Inspection.text: I want to go inside - to the wood and stone. Where it's quiet - safe.

FlamingFist_005.speaker: Fist Gretta
FlamingFist_005.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: solemn

AD_Gnome01Inspection.speaker: Nimble
AD_Gnome01Inspection.text: This is a waste of time - I certainly don't have one.

session_synopses.AD_LoverInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_006: Flaming Fist Cyril is an elf who feels things deeply. An emotive person, he is positive and tries to see the good in everything.  This dialogue contains several states, including resting, on high alert against ghouls, under attack etc..
session_synopses.AD_BrotherInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.AD_ArguingWithFlorrick: Florrick and Vidor are talking between themselves about how to proceed. Florrick wants to wait until Mart Cullagh is awake and can tell them more about the shadowcurse. Vidor wants to plan an attack on Moonrise Towers to rescue Grand Duke Ravengard. They aren't at cross purposes, but they don't agree on much.
session_synopses.AD_WulbrenInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlirtyTiefling: Lakrissa's dialogue after her reunion scene with alfira (or potentially this is her only scene if alfira is dead). Lakrissa is usually playful and flirty but she is a but more restrained here. Still smiling but more somber.
session_synopses.Manip: The Flaming FIst Manip, Vidor, has conflict with Florrick prior to any of these dialogues. He is the sergeant of the FF troops, and believes Florrick is a terrible leader. Player can respond to his idea that he should attack Moonrise.
session_synopses.AD_SisterInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_001: Thadwick is a male dwarf and grumpy is his middle name. He's a bit rough and gruff and has little time for the player - an amateur in his eyes. He warms up to him slightly as we progress through the dialogue. This dialogue cover his major states in Haven.
session_synopses.AD_Gnome02Inspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_005: One of the flaming fists in Haven. Resting after an expedition to SCL.
session_synopses.AD_Gnome01Inspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.

AD_Combat_DockGuard_Ranger.speaker: Harper Naysa
AD_Combat_DockGuard_Ranger.text: Got a blade with your name on it!

ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.speaker: Player
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.text: It's those damn shadows. Be ready!
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.context: NodeContext: start of combat - high tension situation. [Astarion - realises the shadows are attacking]

ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.speaker: Player
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.text: No hesitation - these people are long dead.
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.context: NodeContext: start of combat - high tension situation.

session_synopses.ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat: SCL Haven: Isobel is kidnapped/killed and shadows engulf the inn, combat starts against the shadows. Players find themselves in the middle of it protecting the inn or just because they haven't escaped.

node_data.text: Heading out without Isobel's blessing? Have you got a death wish?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Far from it - thanks for the reminder.
Hate to see the shadows get you before you've begun. Good luck.

session_synopses: Could be one of a number of Last Light guards who sees you leaving without getting the blessing from Isobel and calls out to you to remind you.

AD_DiscussingMarcus.speaker: Harper Callie
AD_DiscussingMarcus.text: But what does Marcus want? What's his target?

AD_DiscussingMarcus.speaker: Jaheira
AD_DiscussingMarcus.text: Haven't you noticed how close an eye he keeps on Isobel? Think about it: no Isobel, no Last Light.

AD_DiscussingMarcus.speaker: Harper Callie
AD_DiscussingMarcus.text: Isobel... of course! We have to apprehend him now, before he can strike.

OutOfPosition.speaker: Jaheira
OutOfPosition.text: Bear with me for a moment, there are better places to talk.

AD_CombatTaunts.speaker: Jaheira
AD_CombatTaunts.text: Serene she might seem, but nature has fangs!

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: The Archdruid Halsin. Do not be surprised that I know your name - you fit a rather singular description.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: And one survivor of the shadow curse's fall ought to know another.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Player
MeetsHalsin.text: No one who witnessed that battle is likely to forget it.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: Not the battle, nor what came after.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: Those of us who saw the birth of the shadow curse seem doomed to return, and bear witness to its work again.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: But I ought to warn you, Halsin. Much as it shames me - it is not the curse I come to cleanse, but the cult.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Player
MeetsHalsin.text: You don't have to explain yourself to me.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: Don't I? We both left this land with a half-victory in hand at most - but only one of us settled for it.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: It has become my way, perhaps, to always have one eye on the next fight. For better or worse, that is the cult.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: Though I will not be the one to fight it, I think. The one you journey with - we have already spoken of infiltrating Moonrise.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: One carrying a tadpole - a True Soul - might be able to reach Ketheric. And then... perhaps we will find a way to fight both our battles.

AD_PlayersAttackJaheira.speaker: Jaheira
AD_PlayersAttackJaheira.text: Harpers, to me! We have a True Soul to crush.

session_synopses.AD_DiscussingMarcus: Jaheira discusses the outing of Marcus as a traitor with another Harper. Marcus is unaware he's been exposed at this stage so they discuss sotto voce.
session_synopses.MeetsHalsin: Halsin and Jaheira conversation to catch them not being a true soul like she's looking for. Instead they have a civil conversation, but bearly do more than scratch the surface
session_synopses.AD_PlayersAttackJaheira: Jaheira calls all of the Harpers in the Haven to fight if you choose to attack them as part of the Entering Haven situation

JaheiraCallToArm.speaker: Jaheira
JaheiraCallToArm.text: To arms! Protect Isobel at all cost!
JaheiraCallToArm.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus should be on the shoulders up to obscure whether or not Jaheira has a weapon in hand (cannot be guaranteed).NodeContext: Shouted during the onset of battle

PAD_SpyTransformationClue.speaker: Player
PAD_SpyTransformationClue.text: Someone - something - shed Flaming Fist armour like a second skin.

IsobelSaved.speaker: Isobel
IsobelSaved.context: NodeContext: Doubled over coughing but telling player not to worry about her.

session_synopses.JaheiraCallToArm: Isobel is being attacked. Jaheira calls people to defend Isobel, as their lives depend on her.This dialog can happen anywhere in Last Light, but mainly close to Isobel's room.
session_synopses.PAD_SpyTransformationClue: If we go up on the roof above Isobelâ€™s room, weâ€™ll find discarded FF armour and some bloodstains from a transformation of some kind. A successful med check shows someone burst out of their armour (Marcus)
session_synopses.IsobelSaved: Once the Flaming Fist has been defeated, a shaken Isobel urges players who helped her to go and assist with the fight in the main room. She is coughing and unwell.
session_synopses.AD_SpyWaiting: Fallback AD if the player clicks on the flaming spy while Isobel is unavailable, or he's somehow forced out of Isobel's room while trying to start HAV_TakingIsobel_FlamingSpy.
