session_synopses.Jaheira_AD_ToIsobel: Jaheira is trying to get to Isobel after the area has been attacked by winged ghouls.
session_synopses.AD_SpyRemindsKO: Player sided with Marcus against Isobel. He will remind the player not to kill her during combat.

001.speaker: Harper Mijah
001.text: Glad you made it through the dark.
001.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: Sincere - you know what could have happened out there

session_synopses.001: Mijah is calm, cool and collected. Despite her young age Mijah has seen more than her fair share of fights. She is an excellent example of a Harper Veteran. This dialogue covers all main states in Haven.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: That eye. In Tymora's name, Wyll? What's happened to you?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: That eye. In Tymora's name, Wyll? What's happened to you?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerNodeContext: Notices player suddenly. HAnd to brow in exasperation.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It's my business, Florrick - not yours.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Fine. Gods know I've got enough worries plucking at my nerves.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Gods, please, no. You were supposed to be my wildcard.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerNodeContext: Notices player suddenly. HAnd to brow in exasperation.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: We believe the cultists have taken Duke Ravengard to Moonrise Towers. I don't suppose you've found a way in?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I don't suppose you've found a way into the Towers?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What's with the fellow in the cot?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Isobel cleared this place, and he just... appeared. We think he was staying at the inn when the curse fell - which means he's been trapped inside for a century.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: It beggars belief he's alive at all.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Hopefully he'll come 'round. Tell us something useful about getting through the shadows. Right now he seems to have little more to him than a refrain from some song or other.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What can you tell me about Isobel?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Cleric of SelÃ»ne - she's got a room upstairs if you want to meet her. Just don't interrupt her while she's doing whatever it is that keeps this place shadow-free.

session_synopses: Florrick is with her Flaming Fist troops in Haven. As you approach, they are furiously trying to put a plan together to rescue Ravengard. The curse is one thing, but Ketheric is invincible. They can't just storm the place. And even if they could, they would execute the prisoners if the alarm was raised - including the Grand Duke.Florrick turns to you, incredibly grateful that we have made it so far. She implores you to work with Jaheira for her rescue efforts, but tells you your priority is clear: Duke Ravengard. He must be returned to the city - it will not survive his absence.

Harper_000.speaker: Harper Lassandra
Harper_000.text: You made it through the dark? Lucky you - not everyone does.

Harper_000.speaker: Harper Lassandra
Harper_000.text: He was a good Harper. A good friend.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: He was joking, this morning. Yonas, I mean.
Harper_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks up to stand behind Meygan, but she doesn't look at them.InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: There was an ambush in the dark. The shadows dragged him away...

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: He was always joking. Said it was good for morale, but he just liked seeing people laugh.
Harper_001.context: NodeContext: Small pause before the line.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: He was a good Harper. A good friend...
Harper_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after finishing this line

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: I thought we could have been something more, one day, but...
Harper_001.context: NodeContext: Chokes up a little. Swallows back her tears.

Harper_001.speaker: Player
Harper_001.text: I'm sure he knew. I'm sure he cared for you as well.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: I don't know. And I never will.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: I'm sorry, I'd like to be alone.

session_synopses.Harper_000: Dialogue in Haven for one of the harper scouts you helped in SCL (SCL_HarperScouts_ShadowCreatures). She is mourning Yonas' death and gives some information about the shadow curse.
session_synopses.Harper_001: Dialogue with Meygan in Last Light. She is standing before an altar, mourning Yonas' death. She might give us something if we give her his sword. Despite changes in the state of the grove, she usually reverts to her normal dialogue/ state of sadness as she was close to Yonas and that's more to the front of her mind than stuff like Ketheric

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Still rattled by what happened at the Emerald Grove, they'll need time to recover before they'll be ready to talk.*

session_synopses: Triggers if Halsin tries to talk to any of the Tiefling refugees in Haven

PAD_TooHeavy.speaker: Player
PAD_TooHeavy.context: NodeContext: tried to shove some rocks in game and they were too heavy

session_synopses.PAD_TooHeavy: The players are trying to disassemble a pile of rocks.Potentially, Marcus has told them about it.

node_data.speaker: His Majesty
node_data.text: *Hiss!*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cat hisses at the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Here, kitty kitty.
False

node_data.speaker: His Majesty
node_data.text: *HISS!*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cat rears back in a defensive stance and hisses at the player, maybe even swipes paws if it's possibe.

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Chk. Why would anyone keep such neurotic creatures as pets?

session_synopses: Cat is hanging around Barcus' workshop. Cat is not very friendly and player won't really be able to change the cat into being friendly, only temporarily not-aggro. If the player intimidates the cat, they can convince the cat to leave into the shadowcurse. Might do followup in future but none planned now. If placated, cat will tell player not to trust Isobel.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Umi
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.context: NodeContext: Unsure. You want to save your friend but you also want to be cautious

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.text: It's fine! Jaheira won't even notice we're gone.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.text: Even if she did, it doesn't matter. Mol needs us.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.context: NodeContext: Determined, you're gonna save mol no matter what

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Umi
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.text: I know, I know. But we need a plan.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: Glad you and Karlach are all right. Well - as all right as any of us.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: A makeshift Harper's fire might not be where I hoped to set up shop, but maybe I've got something you can use anyway.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: And if you find any interesting materials in need of working, I'm happy to help.
Weaponsmith.context: NodeContext: Said with a slightly knowing tone

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: I... hesitated to mention this back in the druids' grove - for obvious reasons - but no one has earned my trust if not you.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: When Elturel was dragged into Avernus, I was drafted into a devil's smithy. It should have been awful, but infernal metal is like a wild horse. Powerful, exuberant - it'll kill you if you lack technique.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: I can sense some, smell it almost, somewhere in the area. Underground, maybe - out there, in the shadows.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: If you find it, bring it to me. I'll make something incredible.

session_synopses.KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD: Umi, Mattis and Ide are discussing a plan to rescue their friend Mol from Moonrise.
session_synopses.Weaponsmith: This is the Haven state and dialogue for Dammon if he is rescued and brought back to the inn. He can be traded with in certain states and can forge a weapon of hellish power if the player brings him the right material.

AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_002.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_002.text: The General will be pleased if you go quietly.

AD_Jaheira_SiegeCombat_001.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Jaheira_SiegeCombat_001.text: These shades are nothing to Those Who Harp.

session_synopses.ARENA_Wave1: Arena Cam for Halsins Lakeside Combat for Wave 1 of enemies spawning

node_data.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
node_data.text: | Thank you for rescuing me. |

node_data.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
node_data.text: | Once we are in Baldur's Gate, you will be rewarded. |

Jailbreak_AD_SpottedMissingPrisoners.text: Get the Warden - the prisoners have escaped!

session_synopses.Jailbreak_AD_SpottedMissingPrisoners: This fires when a guard notices that the prisoners in Moonrise Towers are missing from their cells.

MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.speaker: Narrator
MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.text: *Minthara is supposed to be in a cell - you have some explaining to do.*

MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.speaker: Player
MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.text: Minthara's been released - and that frees up a cell for people like you, who challenge their betters.

MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.speaker: Narrator
MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.text: *You avoided a fight this time, but bullying your way out of Moonrise is a risky proposition.*

session_synopses.MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara: This dialogues occurs when you are seen close to Minthara once she is freed from Moonrise Towers. It needs to be a GEB dialogue, and thus unvoiced - so Minthara won't speak. Instead, she'll react to the outcome with an AD once the guard has left / died.

AD_PrisonComment.speaker: Sentient Amulet
AD_PrisonComment.text: Hohohoooo! Conditions most grim, courtesy of Ketheric Thorm.

session_synopses.AD_PrisonComment: The spirit in the amulet comments on the prison in Moonrise Towers

session_synopses.002: The guard standing just inside the entrance of Moonrise Towers. He is here to slightly nudge the player towards the execution room.

AD_Combat.speaker: Lann Tarv
AD_Combat.context: NodeContext: Entering combat with relish - he was extremely bored

session_synopses.AD_Combat: Bugbear vendor yells at the player when entering combat. If at least one of the players had impressed him, he wil look forward to the challange of fighting them. If they failed to impresse him, he will taunt them. If not of the players attempted to impress him, he will be existed for the bloodshed regardless.

session_synopses.AD_Gnoll001Howl: The connection to the Gnoll Master has been broken and no player is available to start the dialog, so the Gnolls go immediatelly hostile to everyone.

Guard00.speaker: Adept Ghulen
Guard00.text: These cells won't stay empty for long. There are still so many who defy the Absolute.
Guard00.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Fervent, looking forward to more prisoners to torment.

AD_TortureBed.speaker: Narrator
AD_TortureBed.text: *A torture rack. Chilling to behold, and even more so to imagine the horror its victims must have endured.*

session_synopses.Guard00: An Absolute guard at the entrance to the prison. She's the archetypal sadistic prison guard - finding the suffering of her prisoners amusing, and desperate to please her god / superiors.
session_synopses.AD_TortureBed: In Moonrise prison - torture bed with bloodstains.Placed in the room where Minthara is sent after execution scene

AD_MelodiaThorm.speaker: Narrator
AD_MelodiaThorm.text: *Melodia Thorm, loving mother, beloved wife. Her light will never be forgotten.*

session_synopses.AD_MelodiaThorm: Bust of Melodia Thorm in Isobel's Room in Moonrise

PAD_MapMarker.speaker: Player
PAD_MapMarker.text: Someone's marked a spot at the base of Moonrise Towers. Worth a look.

session_synopses.PAD_MapMarker: In the cursed town, players find a map of Moonrise marked with treasure.

session_synopses.AD_ZrellCombat: Players triggered outcast state in MOO by attacking Ketheric in execution or going to the roof before time.Plays in the first combat Zrell participates when the state is active.

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: I see you've taken it upon yourself to rescue Isobel for General Thorm...

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: ...and before I even ordered you to do so. Trying to make me look bad, True Soul...?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Playful and slightly threatening. Toying with the player.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Yes. I have an eye on your position.

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: Oh, do you? Perhaps I'll let you try taking it from me, someday. I think I'd enjoy watching you struggle. And beg.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Somewhere between lascivious and threatening.

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: But not before time. There is more work for you yet.

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: General Thorm has his precious cleric of SelÃ»ne by his side, but he's still short a necromancer.

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: Balthazar is still missing. Your success with Isobel will count for little if you don't find him.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I had a few more questions about the mission.

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: Oh, good. I love answering questions.
node_data.context: NodeContext: sarcastic - getting sick of your shit

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Balthazar was looking for a relic - what is it?
True

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: Oh, good. I love answering questions.
node_data.context: NodeContext: sarcastic - getting sick of your shit

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What if Balthazar's already dead?

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: Death would not silence Balthazar for long. But dead or alive, he is lost.
node_data.context: NodeContext: with a smile -

session_synopses: Dialogue with Z'rell when she's upstairs. This takes place after the execution scene, and involves Z'rell mind-melding to see how players dealt with the goblins, and testing their 'desire' to be one with the Absolute via a second mind-meld. She then gives them the mission to aid Balthazar, giving them the key to his chamber, and instructing them to find evidence of where he can be found.

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard001.text: All quiet? Do you suppose the Absolute's enemies are resting, soldier?
AD_WithGuard001.context: NodeContext: Suddenly cutting, questioning - poking at her underling's complacency.

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_WithGuard001.context: NodeContext: Taken aback at her ferocity

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard001.text: Perhaps you cannot find them - root them out - because they are your allies? Hm?

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_WithGuard001.text: I - no, mistress! I  would never -
AD_WithGuard001.context: NodeContext: Close to pleading - is cut off by Z'rell at the end.

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard001.text: Oh, relax and let me have my fun. This paperwork grows tedious.
AD_WithGuard001.context: NodeContext: Chuckling, suddenly breaking tension. A cruel boss mocking an underling for 'not taking a joke'.

FlamingSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
FlamingSpy.text: My unexpected ally! The General was very pleased with Isobel's return. Don't worry, I told him all about you.
FlamingSpy.context: NodeContext: genuine in the first line, but in the second he sounds smug (he totally took all the credit)

Ogre.speaker: Glourik
Ogre.context: NodeContext: Finger wagging, chiding like a child

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_WithSpy.text: I am free to do more for the Absolute, Disciple. Anything.
AD_WithSpy.context: NodeContext: A terse religious greeting - a better to an underling, annoyed to be speaking to a lower rank

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithSpy.text: Would you cast yourself from the tower-top?

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_WithSpy.text: Of course. I have the Absolute's wings to catch me.

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithSpy.text: Off you go, then. I've always wanted to try those ballistas.

session_synopses.AD_WithGuard001: A patrolling guard stops and reports to Z'rell.
session_synopses.FlamingSpy: Marcus is in Moonrise after either kidnapping isobel OR being thwarted by the player.
session_synopses.Ogre: For the lumbering threat that stands beside the door to the Duke Double scene.
session_synopses.AD_WithSpy: Z'rell and Marcus are talking after Marcus has kidnapped Isobel.

PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.speaker: Player
PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.text: Prisoners. I doubt they'll last long in here.

PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.speaker: Player
PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.text: Careful. One wrong move and we'll be behind bars with them.

AD_FlirtyTiefling.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling.context: NodeContext: leaving without the player, broken hearted and filled with regret

AD_TieflingsFreed.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_TieflingsFreed.context: NodeContext: yelling with authority and confidence

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection.text: Few survive Disciple Balthazar's experiments. This is your chance to submit to the Absolute - to find peace.
AD_TieflingInspection.context: NodeContext: this is, in a strange way, the warden trying to be comforting, even if it comes across cruel

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection.text: I am far gentler than Disciple Balthazar. You wish to live? Grow a spine.
AD_TieflingInspection.context: NodeContext: rubbing salt in the wound

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection.text: Or, if you're very lucky, perhaps he will split you open and sew in a new one.
AD_TieflingInspection.context: NodeContext: a venemous smile at her cruel words

AD_GnomesInJail.speaker: Nimble
AD_GnomesInJail.context: NodeContext: scared and a little frantic

AD_GnomesInJail.speaker: Nickels
AD_GnomesInJail.text: There's something evil here. Below, down, down... argh!
AD_GnomesInJail.context: NodeContext: scared and panicked, noise of pain at 'argh'. Clutches head briefly

AD_GnomesInJail.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_GnomesInJail.text: Unless this 'evil' can get us out of here, I don't want to hear about it.
AD_GnomesInJail.context: NodeContext: doesn't really give a shit his comrade is scrared - focused on himself and the plan

ProdigyBrother.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother.text: Don't talk to us. You're just making it worse.
ProdigyBrother.context: NodeContext: player has refused to help you - furious

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Cal
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: I can't believe Rolan is gone. Gods, just saying it out loud...
AD_ProdigiesInJail.context: NodeContext: frantic, looking through the bars, panicked

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: Let's focus on escaping, all right?

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: We'll give Rolan the send off he deserves - when we're both safe.

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Cal
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: You're right. Let's... let's talk about something else.
AD_ProdigiesInJail.context: NodeContext: heartbroken, but knows lia is right

AD_WardenInspection.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_WardenInspection.text: I'll die before I submit to you, or your pitiful god.

AD_WardenInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenInspection.text: You're not dying, Wulbren - not for a long, long time.
AD_WardenInspection.context: NodeContext: threatening a prisoner with a cold, cruel smile

AD_WardenInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenInspection.text: Extremeties, even organs, can all be removed - piece by piece, yet still you'll breathe.
AD_WardenInspection.context: NodeContext: threatening a prisoner with a cold, cruel smile

AD_WardenInspection.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_WardenInspection.text: I... bet you use that line a lot.
AD_WardenInspection.context: NodeContext: flustered and scared as he tries to be brave during an interrogation

AD_WardenInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenInspection.text: I do. And every, single time, the prisoner cries out for the Absolute - right before they die. You will be no different, little Wulbren.
AD_WardenInspection.context: NodeContext: threatening a prisoner with a cold, cruel smile

AD_ToolRefused.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ToolRefused.text: Gaerdal help me - how about a club? A hammer? Hurry!
AD_ToolRefused.context: NodeContext: on the brink of losing his temper, trying to sound authorative but he really just wants to call the player an idiot

AD_WaitingForGnomes.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WaitingForGnomes.text: Shh. Not a word - the gnomes are on their way.
AD_WaitingForGnomes.context: NodeContext: Quiet, hushed, determined (about to escape the prison)

Guard_004.speaker: Zealot Nadi
Guard_004.text: Don't speak to the prisoners. The Absolute forbids it.

GnomePrisoner_002.speaker: Nickels
GnomePrisoner_002.text: Nimble said to close my eyes. But I can hear it - the stone is screaming.

Boat.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Boat.text: Boat's good to go - all that's left is to ship off.
Boat.context: NodeContext: tense but relieved - they've made it to the boat and are about to flee moonrise

Boat.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Boat.text: My plan, for now, is to hide out on the water. Unless you have a better idea?

Boat.speaker: Player
Boat.text: If I were you, I'd stay on the water. But it's your call.

Boat.speaker: Danis
Boat.text: True - anywhere is better than here.
Boat.context: NodeContext: worried but trying to be confident

Boat.speaker: Danis
Boat.text: But I can't leave without saying this - something big is going on in Moonrise. I heard whispers of something - an army. Do what you have to here, and then leave. Soon.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: Let me guess - 'The Absolute is the only way.'? Don't bother.
ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: disgust - assumes player is a traitor

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: Why don't you and Zevlor take a long walk off a short cliff?
ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: disgust - assumes player is a traitor

ProdigySister.speaker: Player
ProdigySister.text: I'm not with the cultists - I swear it.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: If you're not at the Absolute's beck and call, why are you here?
ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: surprise as her suspicion of the player lessens - mostly confused at why player is here

ProdigySister.speaker: Player
ProdigySister.text: To help. What can I do?

ProdigySister.speaker: Cal
ProdigySister.text: Gnomes next door are up to something. They've been whispering like mad.
ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: furtive, like it's a secret.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: Whatever it is, we're in. Don't leave us in here.
ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: determined - she's gonna get out of here - praying the player will get her and her brother out

AD_ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigySister.text: Let's not push our luck any further - we should move.
AD_ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: tense  - waiting by the boat and safe for now, but that could change at a moment's notice

AD_WardenChase.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenChase.text: The prisoners are escaping! All arms to me - NOW.
AD_WardenChase.context: NodeContext: Roaring with authority and fury

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: Nimble! Check for gaps, cracks - anything to leverage the rock.
Wulbren.context: CinematicNodeContext: Back to the player, speaking to the gnomesNodeContext: determined and confident - used to giving orders and having them followed a she plans his escape

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: Nickels: tools - get creative. This rock is basalt - it'll crack with enough pressure.
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: determined and confident - used to giving orders and having them followed a she plans his escape

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: Ah! Don't mind us, True Soul. The back wall is weak - we're working to brace it.
Wulbren.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns and sees the player. Surpise Ah! And then rallies himself, trying to turn the situation to his advantageNodeContext: Surprise on Ah! sees player, assumes they are the bad guy. Confidently rallies himself and tries to turn the situation to his advantage.

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: I wouldn't be so foolish as to think I could escape the Absolute.
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: player says he's planning an escape. He casually denies it but is also trying to probe the player

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: The Warden has eyes everywhere. And ears.
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: trying to see who's side the player is on

Wulbren.speaker: Player
Wulbren.text: What if I were here to help you escape?

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: Huh. And why would you be so inclined?
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: A beat - wulbren is suspicious of the player but part of him wants to believe the player

Wulbren.speaker: Player
Wulbren.text: My mind is my own - the Absolute has no control over me.

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: The Absolute thinks she's got you by the scruff of the neck, but it's the other way round, isn't it?
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: a beat and then a slow smile - the player has impressed wulbren

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: I reckon you and I were meant to meet - I'm Wulbren.

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: We've a plan - but all the determination in the world is nothing without the right equipment.
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: determined, confident - with the player on his side his plan can work

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: We need tools. That headcase of a Warden robbed ours, but anything that breaks rock will do - even if it's not Ironhand quality.
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: determined, confident - with the player on his side his plan can work

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: Whatever you find, throw it through the bars. But for the love of Gaerdal make sure a guard doesn't see you - or we're both done for.
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: determined, confident - with the player on his side his plan can work

AD_Gnome01.speaker: Nimble
AD_Gnome01.context: NodeContext: leaving the player behind to die as she hops on the boat and leaves

AD_WardenInCombat.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenInCombat.text: Run. Beg. It matters not - this ends now.
AD_WardenInCombat.context: NodeContext: in a fight - absolutely furious with her opponents.

AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners.context: NodeContext: frantic, looking through the bars, panicked

AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners.text: I'll be flayed alive for this.
AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners.context: NodeContext: the usually intimidating warden is terrified for herself - knows her fate for letting the prisoners escpae

GnomePrisoner_001.speaker: Nimble
GnomePrisoner_001.text: Wulbren is the one you want, not I.

AD_GoToTieflings.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_GoToTieflings.text: Break the wall and go - if the tieflings can't keep up, it's their problem.
AD_GoToTieflings.context: NodeContext: running through the prison, brisk tone, he's annoyed he has to free the tieflings

session_synopses.PAD_ApproachingPrisoners: Quick VB about the prisoners and the fate that awaits them. This is mainly used to draw attention to them as the players explore the prison area.
session_synopses.AD_FlirtyTiefling: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingsFreed: Wulbren has just bust down the back wall of a prison to very surprised tieflings, who he barks this out at.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingInspection: Warden has an exchange with the tieflings in Jail.
session_synopses.AD_GnomesInJail: The gnomes are in jail and discussing their predicament. Wulbren is taking charge and nickles and nimble are doing their best to help.
session_synopses.ProdigyBrother: Cal is the brother of Lia and Rolan. He was ambushed along with the other tieflings and taken to Moonrise. His brother Rolan is at Last light inn. He is afraid but trying to be strong for the other tieflings, and is determined to save his sister.
session_synopses.AD_ProdigiesInJail: AD between Cal and Lia in Moonris prison. They are exhausted and being held by murderous cultists of the Absolute.
session_synopses.AD_WardenInspection: Warden heard the gnomes are up to no good and goes verify by herself. The warden stands outside their cell and essentially taunts them - she thinks they are worthless and will die in the cell.
session_synopses.AD_ToolRefused: Wulbren has asked the player to get 'tools'. Player has to throw the tool to him in the cell. In this instance, player has thrown something to him he can't use.
session_synopses.AD_WaitingForGnomes: Tieflings will wait for the gnomes to rescue them if the gnome have tools and their back wall is broken down whilst the tieflings are still in their cells.Their out of combat behaviour has them huddle close to their own wall, hoping for rescue.If combat starts, they give in and start smacking the wall as well.
session_synopses.Guard_004: Nadi doesn't enjoy being a prison guard but considers it her duty. She tries to reassure the player.
session_synopses.GnomePrisoner_002: Nickles is a savant who has an incredible ability to read the earth and stone around him, but is nervous and quite fearful as a person. He is easily frightened. He is imprisoned in moonrise and in the following lines escapes by boat (which he hates)/fights his way out/ and has a general greeting.
session_synopses.Boat: After Wulbren instigates the escape any escaping prisoners try to make it to the boat and flee Moonrise. This dialogue covers the case in which the boat leaves without the player or joins them in the escape.
session_synopses.ProdigySister: This is lia's main dialogue in moonrise towers. She's been taken captive (along with her brother cal) - she doesn't know if her other brother rolan is alive or dead. Lia is brave and used to being in tough situations, but she's terrified for herself anf her brother (and trying to mask it with anger). Her main dialogue occurs with her in a cell and speaking to the player on the other side of the bars. There are additional branches for when she's in one cell and the player was arrested an in the cell next to her.
session_synopses.AD_ProdigySister: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers. This is a high stress and tense situation as this character tries to flee murderous cultists.
session_synopses.AD_WardenChase: Warden runs out of her post to go after the prisoners.
session_synopses.Wulbren: Wulbren is the leader of the Ironhand Gnomes. He is currently imprisoned in moonrise towers. He has the lazy charm of arrogant and the determination and cunning of the leader of a revolution. In this dialogue he offers you the main quest - to free him and the tieflings from the prison. He can speak to you through the bars - either with the player in prison, OR with the player speaking to them from the outside. NOTE: Wulbren pushes hard to charm the player and make them think they're friends. He keeps the friendly and charming mask on tight (dropping it only when he insults the player). We can have the lightest touch of menace in this dialogue, a hint that he's holding something back or that there is more to this than it seems, but it should be a light touch. He is friendly and charming here (the mask will drop back at Haven when he is rescued).
session_synopses.AD_Gnome01: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers.
session_synopses.AD_WardenInCombat: Gnomes and tieflings are escaping, but the guards have spotted them and begun combat. These are the warden's lines. She is a powerful and formidable opponent, and is furious with her prisoners for defying her.
session_synopses.AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners: Plays when she spots no prisoners in the cell.
session_synopses.GnomePrisoner_001: Nimble is a devout and loyal follower of Wulbren (and a bit of a lickarse). He's dedicated to the ironhand gnomes but does not give a crap about anyone else. He is imprisoned in moonrise towers in these lines/fighting his way out/fleeing by boat.
session_synopses.AD_GoToTieflings: Wulbren on the way to free the tieflings.

MasterGrieving.speaker: Linsella
MasterGrieving.text: Poor Barnabus. I'll have to find another favourite.
MasterGrieving.context: NodeContext: Genuinely sad. Her favourite 'pet' gnoll died.

GnollAttack.speaker: Narrator
GnollAttack.text: *All trace of restraint is gone. 'Barnabus' has tasted blood, and wants more.*

GnollAttack.speaker: Narrator
GnollAttack.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
GnollAttack.context: CinematicNodeContext: Symbol on NPC glowsInternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to a companion.

session_synopses.GnollAttack: Upon killing the gnoll master through dialog or through gameplay, gnolls show threatening behavior and will flee as they are not under control anymore unless someone else is present in the room,

PAD_Ritual.speaker: Player
PAD_Ritual.text: Ketheric's been studying something called the Apostle... but of which god?

session_synopses.PAD_Ritual: The party finds a text in Kethericâ€™s chamber that hints at his connection to Myrkul and his â€˜apostleâ€™ form. A successful religion check references death or divinity - not explicitly calling out Myrkul by name.

AD_AccessCultistPrayer.speaker: Radija
AD_AccessCultistPrayer.text: Many hearts, one soul. In Your name, Absolute.

Guard01.speaker: Zealot Bennel
Guard01.text: Seen the view out west from the terrace? All those beasts camped under one banner.

Guard01.speaker: Zealot Bennel
Guard01.text: That's the Absolute's power. The General's power.

session_synopses.AD_AccessCultistPrayer: The cultest standing by the door to the roof of Moonrise recites prayers to herself in tones of quiet reverence. 2 of her ADs echo the prayers of Myrkulite cultist we meet below.
session_synopses.Guard01: An Absolute guard on the upper floor. An officer in the army, reverent and deferential to General Thorm.

Circle.speaker: Narrator
Circle.text: *Carved into the bench's rotted surface are strange, half-faded sigils. A magic circle of some kind, thick with darkness and decay.*
Circle.context: CinematicNodeContext: A shot of the sigil on the desk. It looks dark, evil, unsettling...

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: A ritual circle... and a complex one, at that. I've seen such a construction before, in the writings of the Weavepasha of Almraiven, though his vision was not so... tainted.

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: It's inert, if that's what you mean. But it still reeks of the Shadow Weave, and its polluting magic will continue to escape for as long as it lies abandoned here.

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: The discarded pixie corpses might still contain enough essence, and with one of the broken lantern casements...
Circle.context: NodeContext: Talking himself through an idea.Temptation building, he'd quite like to do this

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: Yes, I think I'd be able to craft one more lantern. And with a slight modification of the casting gesture, it might be able to wield the shadows instead of repelling them...
Circle.context: NodeContext: Talking himself through an idea.Temptation building, he'd quite like to do this

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: Though... Mystra's eyes may be upon me, and she'd forbid me dabbling with such magic. She'd want it destroyed. Wasted, arguably.
Circle.context: NodeContext: Coming back to himself after getting carried away, remembering he might get in trouble for creating the lantern. A hint he'd like you to encourage him to use it.

Circle.speaker: Shadowheart
Circle.text: Forget what Mystra wants - think about yourself, and what Lady Shar's power could do for you, Gale. Make the Lantern - spread her will.
Circle.context: NodeContext: 'And rightly so' = SH turned from Shar. 'Forget what Mystra wants' = SH loyal to Shar.

Circle.speaker: Player
Circle.text: Let me deal with the circle.

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: Deal with it how? I hate to pull rank, but I was once Mystra's Chosen. Destroying magic like this was my bread and butter.

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: Or did you wish to use it? I assure you - it's pointless. You'll have nothing more than a sore head and a very dissatisfied wizard to show for it.

Circle.speaker: Player
Circle.text: Very well. Destroy the circle Gale.

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: Some room then, if you please.
Circle.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives Gale some space (excuse to have him alone in next shot)NodeContext: With a small sigh - knows this is the right thing to do but a bit disappointed nonetheless

Circle.speaker: Narrator
Circle.text: *It doesn't take much. The sigils fade, the circle's tainted magic dissolving harmlessly into the ether.*
Circle.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale reaches out confidently towards the sigil, focused on its destruction. The sigil flares briefly, then fades. It's extinguished.

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: Not bad for a wizard who slept through his Calishite lessons, eh?

session_synopses.Circle: Gale finds the way Balthazar has been enchanting Moonlanterns and decides to steal some of his methodology.

GuardObserver.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver.text: I see Marls took... took a bit of a dive.

GuardObserver.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver.text: Good riddance. He deserved it! ... whatever he did.
GuardObserver.context: NodeContext: Vehemently on our side - he does not want to piss us off like his ill-fated friend did. Last line a little uncertain.

GuardObserver.speaker: Player
GuardObserver.text: Are you much of a swimmer?

GuardObserver.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver.text: No, True Soul. Not I. Too busy doing my job. Which... I'll get back to, aye?

Vat.speaker: Narrator
Vat.text: *A wave of sick familiarity radiates from one barrel amidst the cargo.*

Vat.speaker: Narrator
Vat.text: *Tadpoles. Sleeping and scarcely aware, but echoing yours a hundredfold.*

AD_Minthara_AtDocks.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_AtDocks.text: Shipments of parasites, bound for Baldur's Gate. Half the city may be infected already.

AD_ObserverFishing.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_ObserverFishing.text: Must've found some booze among the supplies. Idiot.
AD_ObserverFishing.context: NodeContext: Irritated, speaking to comrade who's just jumped into the water and sank

GuardPatroller001.speaker: Adept Bel
GuardPatroller001.context: NodeContext: Nervous of us, wants to get back to patrolling

AD_ObserverInspect.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_ObserverInspect.context: NodeContext: Ill-MAY-ter - a god of martyrdom. The curse is a bit like 'Jesus Christ', with a creative 'arsing' thrown in.

Checkpoint.speaker: Narrator
Checkpoint.text: *Her thoughts invade your own, hunting for recognition. Your parasite offers it, readily.*

Checkpoint.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint.text: True Soul. A pleasure. What news from the field?

GuardPatroller000.speaker: Zealot Renan
GuardPatroller000.text: Hold your nose 'round the crates. Some got a little ripe down in the cellar.

session_synopses.GuardObserver: Guard is watching operations at Moonrise Docks. If the other guard jumped into the water, the player can use it to send this last guard away so they can examine the cargo.
session_synopses.Vat: The player has investigated the vat, showing thousands of tadpoles. They are being used to bolster their number of soldiers for their attack on Baldurs Gate. The player can destroy the Vat, depriving some of their numbers, or utter a phrase to influence whoever these tadpoles end up attached to.
session_synopses.AD_Patroller001Witness: DockPatroller_001 witness DockJumper jump into the water.
session_synopses.AD_ObserverFishing: The Dock Guard Observer is standing peering over the dock where one of his subordinates just jumped into the water for apparently no reason. All lines are low grumbling, as if spoken to the dead man.
session_synopses.AD_Patroller000Witness: DockPatroller_000 witness DockJumper jumping into the water.
session_synopses.GuardPatroller001: An Absolute guard protecting crates at the dock.
session_synopses.AD_ObserverInspect: The dock observer has seen that the Vat he was in charge of was destroyed. He articulates this disappointment.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: The guard mindmelds with player, senses their tadpole, and gladly lets them into the towers, telling them to report to Disciple Z'rell (Zuh-rELL).
session_synopses.GuardPatroller000: An Absolute guard protecting crates at the dock.

AD_DUBackgroundBook.text: Tendays of dissections of a still-living victim.

Guard01.speaker: Acolyte Kimmeral
Guard01.text: Don't mind Mig and her 'meat sounds'. It's just her brain slopping around in her skull.
Guard01.context: NodeContext: Mig is an ogre complaining about 'meat sounds' - you are reluctantly sharing a room with the ogre, and explaining his weirdness away

session_synopses.Guard01: A guard stationed alongside Mig the ogre. Mig is complaining of hearing "meat sounds" - in actuality it's a monster moving through the walls. This guard doesn't believe him either way.

AD_GuardsInterrupt.speaker: Mig
AD_GuardsInterrupt.text: Monster lives in this tower. Something big.

AD_GuardsInterrupt.speaker: Acolyte Kimmeral
AD_GuardsInterrupt.text: You're the biggest thing here. Nothing to be afraid of, lass.

session_synopses.AD_GuardsInterrupt: Mig the Ogre says she hears things in the walls. The other two guards on duty beside her are unconvinced - one irritated, the other sympathetic but skeptical

AD_GuardJumper.speaker: Acolyte Marls
AD_GuardJumper.text: Can't believe you'd betray the Absolute. Idiot.

AD_AccessCultistCombat.speaker: Radija
AD_AccessCultistCombat.text: You'll die before you reach my lord. Perhaps then you will be obedient.
AD_AccessCultistCombat.context: NodeContext: Grim, angry. Promising to kill us and resurrect us as a more obedient slave.

AD_JaheiraSolo.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraSolo.text: Here we stand in the lion's den, but the lions are you and I.

HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster.text: It's a grim task, picking provisions from the dead.

HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster.text: But the way I hear it, the fighting's not done yet. You need to resupply?

HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster.context: NodeContext: Blessing - as absent as saying 'god bless', not overly pious

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger.speaker: Harper Naysa
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger.text: You fight as well as any Harper. Careful, or Jaheira might have to keep you.
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger.context: NodeContext: Wry, a little breathless. Lull in battle.

Jaheira_TopOfTowerBackup.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_TopOfTowerBackup.text: It's all up to you now. Ketheric awaits.

Executioner.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner.text: You dare show yourself here, after all you've done?
Executioner.context: NodeContext: impressed to have seen a legendary hero (Jaheira) up close and personal - really wants to kill said hero

Executioner.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner.text: You have betrayed me, you have betrayed General Thorm - you have betrayed our god!
Executioner.context: NodeContext: building fury, peaking on final phrase

Executioner.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner.text: And for what? That little firefly buzzing around overhead? I'll crush you first, then her - and in death, you will all serve the Absolute.

CrestfallenHound_SwA.speaker: Squire
CrestfallenHound_SwA.text: That scent - the SelÃ»nite magic on your skin - it fills this place.

CrestfallenHound_SwA.speaker: Squire
CrestfallenHound_SwA.text: It fills my head with things I miss. I cannot remember them, but I do miss them.
CrestfallenHound_SwA.context: NodeContext: Sadly - thinking of a past life, barely remembered

KethericLeaving.speaker: Narrator
KethericLeaving.context: InternalNodeContext: The tentacle "picks up" Nightsong and Ketheric. (TBD edge-case: Nightsong's body is not on the roof anymore or is in an inventory)

AssaultHarper_001.speaker: Harper Lanni
AssaultHarper_001.text: Onwards. Ketheric can't hide from us now!
AssaultHarper_001.context: NodeContext: A lull in battle - fervent, caught up in the moment

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger.speaker: Harper Lymn
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger.text: The false god creeps. The city must wake.
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger.context: NodeContext: Referencing the fact that we need to get to the city.

FirstKethericInterruption.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric staggers, weakened. Nightsong spreads her wings and lifts off the ground, preparing for a final blowNodeContext: Ragged breathing, hunched over in terrible shape

FirstKethericInterruption.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption.text: You must return to your prison. And my daughter must be reclaimed.
FirstKethericInterruption.context: CinematicNodeContext: At the sound of 'my daughter' Nigthsong is distracted and looks in concern - she doesn't know Isobel is alive.InternalNodeContext: to Nightsong

FirstKethericInterruption.speaker: Nightsong
FirstKethericInterruption.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong is shocked; just then, Ketheric gestures with his arm, NodeContext: At first, trying to understand what ketheric means. Incredulous - only thing that could have stopped her mid-rampage was hearing the name of the lover she thought dead
CinematicNodeContext: The tentacle BURSTS through a wall beside Ketheric

FirstKethericInterruption.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption.text: You will fall as sure as she. This has only begun.
FirstKethericInterruption.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tentacle slaps Nightsong from the sky, then zaps Ketheric and Nightsong down into the colony, leaving a crevice through which the player can follow.InternalNodeContext: to player

AssaultFlamingFist_001.speaker: Fist Nipawa
AssaultFlamingFist_001.text: Watching gods. These poor bastards actually die believing.
AssaultFlamingFist_001.context: NodeContext: Vague disbelief, regret - they're killing people who believe in a nonsense god.

DarkUrgeButlerReminder.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
DarkUrgeButlerReminder.text: That was rather rude, wasn't it? To assume I am content to be killed by one of low breeding.

DarkUrgeButlerReminder.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
DarkUrgeButlerReminder.text: I want you to go away, and think about what you did.

AssaultFlamingFist_002.speaker: Fist Helena
AssaultFlamingFist_002.text: Come on. Plenty more to do yet.
AssaultFlamingFist_002.context: NodeContext: Heat of battle, focused and not really interested in conversation.

AssaultHarper_003.speaker: Harper Lilineth
AssaultHarper_003.text: This place... stinks of blood and fear. That is all the Absolute offers.
AssaultHarper_003.context: NodeContext: Disgust and scorn for the Absolute.

PAD_ReadyToMeetKetheric.speaker: Player
PAD_ReadyToMeetKetheric.text: Ketheric Thorm is waiting for us. Are we ready?

DaisyAD_FollowKetheric.text: That tentacle was colossal. The same creature we encountered before. We must follow where it went.

Jaheira_Following.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_Following.text: Our host is at the top of the tower. Rude to keep him waiting, no?

Jaheira_Following.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_Following.text: It is I who follows you. But, if I must venture some advice... this is the simple part. Ketheric dies, or we do. And the Sword Coast with us.

AssaultHarper_002.speaker: Harper Grenywald
AssaultHarper_002.text: This place is all dark corners. Stay sharp, eh?
AssaultHarper_002.context: NodeContext: Tense, in the heart of the enemy's tower.

JaheiraThroneRoomOrders.speaker: Jaheira
JaheiraThroneRoomOrders.text: Patrol this floor, Harpers. Watch the doors and watch the windows. Nothing enters or exits these rooms alive.

PAD_AfterKethericCombat.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterKethericCombat.text: That thing came from below. We need to find out where it took Ketheric.

AD_PrisonWarden.speaker: The Warden
AD_PrisonWarden.text: I'll smear your entrails on these walls. In Her name!

TentaclelessJump.context: CinematicNodeContext: Black screen and noise of player sliding - then HEAVY THUD. Fade in to find party standing, dusting themselves off.
CinematicNodeContext: Shots of eerie organic architecture.

TentaclelessJump.text: This must be where they harvest the tadpoles. We're close to the source of the infections.
TentaclelessJump.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shots of eerie organic architecture.
CinematicNodeContext: Player standing, facing down long dark tunnel ahead.

AssaultFlamingFist_004.speaker: Fist Hadenwell
AssaultFlamingFist_004.text: We'll hold this point. Give Ketheric our regards, aye?
AssaultFlamingFist_004.context: NodeContext: Grim resolve - they've fought all the way up the tower, and now it's up to us

HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger.speaker: Harper Antony
HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger.text: We're pushing them back. The Moonmaiden's with us.

PAD_PrisonSkeletonWarning.speaker: Player
PAD_PrisonSkeletonWarning.text: The battle won't be won down here.

session_synopses.AD_GuardJumper: During the assault on Moonrise. If the player "fixed" the dock jumpers mind, his combat AD will be a bit garbled.
session_synopses.AD_AccessCultistCombat: She is the last line of defence to the roof of the tower during the assault on Moonrise. She yells this on her turn during combat.
session_synopses.AD_JaheiraSolo: Jaheira is outside Moonrise Towers, talking to herself contemplating her next steps to assault the tower (if Florrick is available, a different AD plays). Once the main floor has been cleared of enemies, she makes comments about the tower and the assault.(Triggers regardless of if Florrick is present).
session_synopses.HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster: If Florrick is present during the assault, the Harper Quartermaster will be present as well to provide trade to the player. They are not invloved in the combat, but will move into the tower once things are cleared.
session_synopses.HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger: Naysa is one of the Harpers who fights beside you at Moonrise.
session_synopses.Executioner: Zrell 'greets' the player inside the Tower along with the rest of the Monnrise offencive force during the assault on Moonrise. Nightsong might be alive or dead.This is a stand-off - she's protecting the tower, and the players are attacking. Z'rell is confident that she'll put the players and their allies down here, and shows no fear.
session_synopses.CrestfallenHound_SwA: If Ketherics Hound smelled Isobel's blessing on the player, she will move into Isobels room and not participate in the combat ongoing throughout the tower, as she is lost in vague feelings and hazy memories of a life past.
session_synopses.KethericLeaving: During the boss fight on the rooftop, a tentacle teleports Ketheric away
session_synopses.AssaultHarper_001: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger: Lymn is one of the Harpers who fights with us at Moonrise.She speaks in a unique cadence because Common is her Seventh language. She is focused on feelings and impressions.
session_synopses.FirstKethericInterruption: When Ketheric is at low health, this cinematic trigges. Ketheric transports himself into the colony, taking Nightsong with him if she's present.
session_synopses.AssaultFlamingFist_001: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.DarkUrgeButlerReminder: The player has never spoken to Isobel before starting the assault on Moonrise. The Butler appears in front of the player on the bridge to Moonrise to remind the Dark Urge player that they must kill Isobel if they want to please Bhaal.
session_synopses.AssaultFlamingFist_002: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.AssaultHarper_003: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.PAD_ReadyToMeetKetheric: Players won the fight near the door that leads to the roof for the showdown with Ketheric. With this PAD we both confirm that and pre-warn player that the next fight is tough and better to restock
session_synopses.DaisyAD_FollowKetheric: Top of the tower, after fight with Ketheric and seeing the giant tentacle.
session_synopses.Jaheira_Following: Jaheira's follower dialogue for Moonrise when she's actively accompanying the player.
session_synopses.AssaultHarper_002: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.JaheiraThroneRoomOrders: Jaheira has arrived inside the Moonrise Towers throne room after clearing the out all the enemies. If there are any Harpers alive, Jaheira will give them orders to patrol around the tower.
session_synopses.AssaultFlamingFist_003: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterKethericCombat: After attacking Ketheric on the Moonrise Rooftop, a tentacle tears through one of the towers and provides a hole that leads down into the mind flayer Colony. The party must follow Ketheric down there to continue the main quest, and this PAD should hint at that.
session_synopses.AD_PrisonWarden: Combat AD when the player is assaulting Moonrise tower. The prison warden has is defending the throne room.
session_synopses.AD_ZrellCombat: The player has entered combat with Z'rell during the assault on Moonrise (freed Nightsong).
session_synopses.TentaclelessJump: Roof teleport, Assault on Moonrise path
session_synopses.AssaultFlamingFist_004: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.AD_BarnabusCombat: A combat AD that plays on Barnabus' turn during the Moonrise Assault. If the player freed them, they are allied with them and will call back to that. Otherwise, he will do a generic combat AD.
session_synopses.HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger: Antony is a Harper who fights with us at Moonrise.
session_synopses.PAD_PrisonSkeletonWarning: The player has entered the Moonrise prison during the assault (with some warning against in most cases). This is a final heads up to the player that the skeletons they are fighting will just keep respawning with no reward, so it is best to leave asap.

Guard_003.speaker: Zealot Falla
Guard_003.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: a blessing / saying in their church

AD_DarraPlea.speaker: Darra
AD_DarraPlea.context: NodeContext: a plea to nobody in particular

Guard_005.speaker: Adept Nola
Guard_005.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Disgruntled, wants to get on her with work

Guard_004.speaker: Zealot Munish
Guard_004.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Blessing

AD_SazzaPlea.speaker: Sazza
AD_SazzaPlea.text: I didn't survive mad druids and hungry spiders to die here.

AD_GoblinsInCombat.speaker: Darra
AD_GoblinsInCombat.text: I won't go easy, if that's what yeh think.
AD_GoblinsInCombat.context: NodeContext: The drow that was controlling your actions just died and you're about to run away

Guard_006.speaker: Zealot Rylveth
Guard_006.text: I swore myself to Lolth for years. But she never let me sack a city.
Guard_006.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Looking forward to the fight to come

session_synopses.AD_MintharaPlea: Minthara is pleading for her life before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.
session_synopses.Guard_003: Female Human. Guard and Absolute cultist.
session_synopses.AD_DarraPlea: Goblins are pleading for their lives before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.
session_synopses.Guard_005: Female Human. Guard and Absolute cultist. Magic user.
session_synopses.Guard_004: Male Half Orc. Guard and Absolute cultist.
session_synopses.AD_SazzaPlea: Goblins are pleading for their lives before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinsInCombat: The goblins have just been attacked by the player - they know the player is probably going to kill then.
session_synopses.Guard_006: Female Drow. Guard and Absolute cultist.

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: Flesh! Flank-flesh!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Feral, starving - catching player's scent

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: Foot-flesh!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Feral, starving - catching player's scent

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: SILENCE!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Throwing up a hand to silence her comrades to either sideNodeContext: Silencing her comrades, turning to speak to player head-on

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: We hunger, True Soul. The Absolute promised us a feast of corpses, and still we starve!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Just as starving and feral as her companions, but a better grip on herself.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I honestly didn't know your kind could string a sentence together.

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: The ones below are kept starving and stupid. But not I - I know where the real feast is.

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: They drop corpses down into the tunnels below the tower. Enough to feed an army of us!

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: If the Absolute will not share Her dead flesh... we will tear it from the backs of the living.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Shifting to a hostile tone, threatening us

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Symbol on NPC glowsInternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to a companion.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Have patience. There's a lot of flesh waiting in Baldur's Gate.
False

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: But you... you look so much juicier. FEED!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Has the scent of our blood now, won't be put off by threats. Last line is finally letting her feral side out as she orders her companions to attack us.

session_synopses: The player encounters a pack of winged ghouls on Moonrise's upper exterior. They are disgusting undead who are eternally starving for dead and rotting flesh. Though intelligent, they can be near feral in their need to feed.In this case, the player meets a still-intelligent one with two less-bright comrades. The leader challenges the player, saying the cult has promised them plenty of meat but they've received none. Instead, the corpses are dropped below the tower (unbeknownst to them, to be fed to the Elder Brain or used in the Necromancer's experiments)

DaisyAD_AttackImmortal.text: He cannot die - we must find what gives him his invulnerability before we strike!

DaisyAD_AttackImmortalRepeated.text: It won't work - not until we find out what is keeping him from death!

session_synopses.DaisyAD_AttackImmortal: If player inflicts combat with immortal Ketheric Daisy urges to fallback and solve the problem of invulnerability first
session_synopses.DaisyAD_AttackImmortalRepeated: If player inflicts combat with immortal Ketheric Daisy urges to fallback and solve the problem of invulnerability first

PAD_TownVista.speaker: Player
PAD_TownVista.text: This must have been quite a view, once.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: I'll tell you a story, True Soul. About a man who sold himself piece by piece.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: He had... everything. A wonderful wife. A brilliant daughter. They lived not far from here.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: His wife died too young. Grief tore through their home like a thief, snatching away the scent of her hair, the rustle of her skirts. But the man did not break.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: He could not break. His daughter needed him whole, after all.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: She grew up - grew strong. Challenged him. Filled his heart with such joy it supplanted all sorrow.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: When she was killed, the man... he tried to remain whole, but it wasn't possible. Do you understand?

Ketheric.speaker: Player
Ketheric.text: So the man fell to pieces.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: The pain was unbearable. All-consuming. He decided he'd do anything for reprieve.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: First, he sold himself to the goddess of loss. But the pain did not subside, no matter his obscene feats of devotion.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: Then a new god came - a god who promised the man something wonderful: his daughter. Her life returned. Imagine it.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: He would have to give everything: his body and soul entire. He did not hesitate. Not for a moment.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: And the new god did as promised. The man's brilliant, beautiful daughter came back. She was whole - she was alive. But she despised the pitiful wretch her father had become.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: Her hatred he could bear, perhaps, as long as she had another chance to live.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: Everything I've done, everything I have built, has been to give Isobel that chance. And you, True Soul - you have squandered it.

Ketheric.speaker: Player
Ketheric.text: You brought her back once. Do it again.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: I can. I will. But it is not without cost. Who will pay this time, True Soul?

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: I have no mercy left in me - but it is for the Absolute to decide your fate.
Ketheric.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

AD_MumblingSul.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
AD_MumblingSul.text: Cleric of the moon, alas! Too soon for the Chosen.

session_synopses.PAD_TownVista: On Moonrise's Rooftop. Vista of TWN and beyond that, HAV and SCL
session_synopses.AD_MumblingSul: Sul acts as wine servent to Ketheric. He speaks in riddles, he mind clearly filled by the fog of the Elder Brain, boarderline thrall.

AD_Execution.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution.text: Considering all that is at stake...

AD_Execution.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution.text: Considering how close we are to the conclusion of our efforts...

AD_Execution.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution.text: I ask you again: why am I here?
AD_Execution.context: NodeContext: Bitter vitriol in his voice.

session_synopses.AD_Execution: Ketheric's AD before the execution. Bitter vitriol in his voice.

AD.speaker: Kar'niss
AD.text: A place. A place for us.
AD.context: NodeContext: muttered to self, awe, insane

session_synopses.AD: Generic repeated AD for the Drider while he is at the top of the tower at the chapel.

AD_Minthara_EnteredKethericRoom.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredKethericRoom.text: This is where the great General Thorm rests his bones? We should ransack it.

PAD_FeelingSick.speaker: Player
PAD_FeelingSick.text: Ugh. That potion... did not go down well.

session_synopses.PAD_FeelingSick: The player has given blood to the Infernal Vendor to make a unique potion. Once this potion is used, the player who gave the blood will feel sick after long rest (applying a debuff).The potion's effect depends on the player, but the debuff is universal.

Guard2.speaker: Adept Merim
Guard2.text: Plenty of supplies if you're running low, True Soul.

AD_Guards.speaker: Zealot Malik
AD_Guards.text: Before the Absolute? I was nobody.

Drider.speaker: Narrator
Drider.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a voice whispering to you. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the darkness?*

Drider.speaker: Kar'niss
Drider.text: A - a True Soul? Why would one of your followers fight with the Harpers, Majesty?

Drider.speaker: Player
Drider.text: I was trying to infiltrate the Harpers, until you ruined it.

Drider.speaker: Kar'niss
Drider.text: We are no fools - we will not be deceived by the likes of you!

session_synopses.Guard2: Guard who stops you at the entrance to Moonrise Towers.
session_synopses.Ghoul3: Trianglehead ghoul at the entrance to Moonrise Tower.Inclusion will only trigger once on one of the three ghouls (so the inclusion on all three should be the same.)
session_synopses.AD_Ghouls: Two ghouls patrol near the entrance of Moonrise. They have beef with the winged ghouls higher up on the exterior of the tower. They (very roughly) talk about their dislike for the winged chouls.
session_synopses.AD_Guards: The two guards at Moonrise entrance kill time wile on duty.
session_synopses.Drider: Player arrives at Moonrise Tower with the drider.https://docs.google.com/document/d/11ofonJmDnosKsHlpOAejRRQ_lbzwimo8nMFIjcSUkYo

AD_TorturersPostTorture.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersPostTorture.text: Soon, we will be in Baldur's Gate. What say you to that, sister?

AD_TorturersPostTorture.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersPostTorture.text: A whole city in service of the Absolute - it will be glorious.

AD_TorturersPostTorture.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersPostTorture.text: And so many minds for us to break.

AD_FailedInterrogation.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_FailedInterrogation.text: Break them, before they call for help.
AD_FailedInterrogation.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

Torturer2.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torturer2.text: I'd bruise every traitor's mind a thousand times over, if the Warden commanded it.

Torturer2.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torturer2.text: And I do hope she commands it.

Torturer1.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torturer1.text: Minthara sustains the Absolute's unhealing wound.

Torturer1.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torturer1.text: There will be more traitors still. They too must suffer - see to it.

Drow.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow.text: I expected to be greeted as a hero - but the wretches imprisoned me, and tried to tear my mind apart.

Drow.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow.text: I didn't think anyone would come for me.

Drow.speaker: Player
Drow.text: I came here for the pleasure of killing you myself.

Drow.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow.text: I think not - the pleasure will be all mine.

session_synopses.AD_TorturersPostTorture: Torture scene with Minthara and her torturers is over. This dialog holds two variants, the variant where Minthara is present, therefore she's been pacified mentally and is now an obedient soldier. The other variant is the one where players take over and make the torturers leave by faking that Minthara's pacified.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: The player is accompanied by Minthara and is stopped by the entrance guards. They do not think Minthara should be allowed to leave.
session_synopses.AD_FailedInterrogation: On Minthara's turn, in combat after failing to pass by an interrogating guard.
session_synopses.Torturer2: Jasin looks for an excuse to beat the crap out of the prisoners.
session_synopses.Torturer1: Sumera loves her job and any excuse to cause a little pain. One-liner after torturing Minthara.
session_synopses.Drow: Minthara is being psychically tortured in the Moonrise Tower dungeon, having been sent there for failing in her mission to capture the weapon the Absolute was seeking (the Orpheus artefact).Two drow guards are torturing her, but they do not lay a finger on her. Instead, they have stripped away her psychic defenses and are using mind-melds to destroy her from the inside.The player can free her by killing the guards, or by mind-melding with Minthara and pulling her out of the despair. If she is freed from the mind-meld while the guards are alive, she kills them.The player can also destroy Minthara completely, by telepathically lobotomising her inside her own mind.

Hound_SwA.speaker: Player
Hound_SwA.text: Gently reach out to pet the hound.

Hound_SwA.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA.text: *Warily, it watches you approach. There's no flesh or fur to scratch at, only bone and cold metal...*

Hound_SwA.speaker: Narrator
Hound_SwA.text: *...but it seems the touch is enough, and for a moment the undead beast is just another dog happily wagging its tail.*
Hound_SwA.context: CinematicNodeContext: Re-use animation from player petting Scratch at camp.

session_synopses.Hound_SwA: The players encounters Ketheric's undead hound in his chambers while sneaking around the tower. She's territorial - but if she smells Isobel's blessing on us she'll recognise Selunite magic. She reveals that she misses the way her master used to be.

PAD_Escape.speaker: Player
PAD_Escape.text: The stink of that place might never wash out.

session_synopses.CorpseMembranes_Dead: The Speak With Dead dialog for the corpse hidden behind the mind flayer membranes in the bloodbath section of the Oubliette. This corpse is currently a goblin, but its race and backstory can be changed at the writer's behest.
session_synopses.PAD_Escape: A PAD of the players reacting to escaping the Oubliette after having been in the bloodbath section, where they literally waded through blood and human remains. The players climb up the cliff face and arrive in the cavern adjacent to the prison.

Eye.speaker: Narrator
Eye.text: *The eye focuses on you, taking in every detail of your appearance.*

Eye.speaker: Narrator
Eye.text: *As far as you can tell, it is a simple construct designed to provide additional security.*

session_synopses.Eye: A dialogue you can have with any of the scrying eyes that patrol moonrise towers. It was written to give a hint that Gortash/one of his cronies are watching you from beyond.

PAD_SharranObservation.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_SharranObservation.text: There is nothing Sharran about this man. He has betrayed the Dark Lady.

Zhent02.speaker: Yerle
Zhent02.text: Ain't looking to convert, True Soul. Gods mind their mess, I mind mine.
Zhent02.context: NodeContext: Respectful but flat refusal - most Absolutists want to convert others, and she's pre-empting it.

BazEntranceGuard.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard.text: Each pack of 'recruits' they bring in is worse than the last.
BazEntranceGuard.context: InternalNodeContext: Belub is not impressed by the new pilgrims who have shown up to join the Absolutes cause.

BazEntranceGuard.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard.text: Can't trust them to sweep the stables, let alone swing a sword.

BazEntranceGuard.speaker: Player
BazEntranceGuard.text: Then get rid of them. The undeserving should be purged.

BazEntranceGuard.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard.text: I-  yeah. Yeah, they're dead weight. Not real believers like us.
BazEntranceGuard.context: NodeContext: Slowly coming around to an opinion

BazEntranceGuard.speaker: Acolyte Belub
BazEntranceGuard.text: Thank you, True Soul. In Her name!

AD_BugbearThrow.speaker: Lann Tarv
AD_BugbearThrow.text: I could hit a pixie from a hundred paces.
AD_BugbearThrow.context: NodeContext: congratulating himself on a well-thrown axe, while practicing

BazaarStander_006.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006.text: The prisoners below are gone, True Soul. I cannot understand why they would flee Her mercy.
BazaarStander_006.context: InternalNodeContext: The prisoners successfully escaped from Moonrise's dungeons (perhaps all, perhaps only one)NodeContext: Confused, hurt - prisoners in the cell escaped - she saw them as heathens her church was trying to 'save'

BazaarStander_007.speaker: Pilgrim Taima
BazaarStander_007.text: I hear you've been summoned for an audience with Her. You will return changed, I'm sure of it.
BazaarStander_007.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Wishing us well - we're about to get our 'reward'

Guard01.speaker: Adept Furek
Guard01.text: You should go through the main hall. Witnessing the General's justice is an honour.

Bystander01.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01.text: Heard a rumour some do-gooder stopped a horde of Absolutists from getting their hands on a load of druids in some grove.

Bystander01.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01.text: Whoever it was better pray the General doesn't smoke 'em out. Be a bloodbath, so it would.

Bystander00.speaker: Brawler Orik
Bystander00.text: You're the best True Soul I ever met.

Guard00.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00.text: I saw it, True Soul. The army. They're nearly ready. It's nearly time.

Guard00.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00.text: I'm trained as an assassin. House Hekar. Perhaps I can serve as a scout - or special operations.

Guard00.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00.text: When the call comes, I'll be ready.

AD_GoblinsListening.speaker: Brawler Weneg
AD_GoblinsListening.text: Enough! Just leave the bloody True Souls to their business.

AD_GoblinsListening.speaker: Brawler Wim
AD_GoblinsListening.text: And what's to say that couldn't be us? They say the General rewards them as serve him well.

AD_GoblinsListening.speaker: Brawler Orik
AD_GoblinsListening.text: And what about them who hang around his door like a bad smell?

Bystander03.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
Bystander03.text: She sees everything we are, do you understand? There is no hiding from Her!

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.speaker: Brawler Orik
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.text: This ain't what we was promised. The Absolute's our god.
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.context: NodeContext: Bitter, been quietly seething on this for a while

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.speaker: Brawler Wim
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.text: She belongs to everyone, git. That's the point.
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.context: NodeContext: Hushing a friend who's saying things that might get them killed

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.speaker: Brawler Weneg
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.text: We're all friends, right? All one under the Absolute.
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.context: NodeContext: Said with a meaningful tone, overrding the doubts/concerns of his comrade who's speaking blasphemy

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.speaker: Brawler Orik
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.text: Don't bloody feel like it, all of a sudden.

Zhent00.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00.text: Ah, a new face come to bask in the light of the Absolute. How can I be of service, True Soul?

Zhent00.speaker: Player
Zhent00.text: Are you a follower of the Absolute?

Zhent00.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00.text: Blessed by association, let's say. I come to pay proper respect to a new power.

Zhent00.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00.text: I'd bow, but the Zhentarim prefer to look their business partners in the eye.

session_synopses.PAD_SharranObservation: Shadowheart notices that Ketheric is no longer a Sharran
session_synopses.Zhent02: A Zhentarim agent guarding Roah Moonglow. She's looking around at the growing power of the church and feeling wary of it.
session_synopses.BazEntranceGuard: Standing at the entrance of Moonrise Tower, the guard is keeping eye on all the fresh blood seeking audience with the Absolute. The player can influence the guard to send the pilgrims to their death in Town, or to take a chance on them and send them as fodder to colony. Either way the pilgrims will have a bad time.
session_synopses.AD_BugbearThrow: The bugbear vendor in Moonrise spends his time throwing an axe at a target. He is quite full of himself and proud of his strength.
session_synopses.BazaarStander_006: A novice of the church of the Absolute, by turns praying to herself or speaking to us, who she sees as a leading follower of her god
session_synopses.BazaarStander_007: This novice has joined the church in the hopes of being elevated to True Soul. She's not here for personal gain, but seeking an actual religious experience - one she believes we've already been blessed to have.
session_synopses.Guard01: A guard watching the alarm system on the ground floor of Moonrise Tower. He love and respects authority, and enjoys the thought of failure being punished.
session_synopses.Bystander01: A goblin on the floor of Moonrise Towers, chatting absently while being a bystander. His commentary changes depending on how the player handled the grove.
session_synopses.Bystander00: A goblin on the floor of Moonrise Towers, chatting absently while being a bystander. This one is worried about the other goblins that were sent to the execution room.
session_synopses.Guard00: A guard watching the alarm system on the ground floor of Moonrise Tower. He's brusque to anyone who approaches.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinsListening: The Bazaar Goblins are listening into the execution, worried about their own necks.
session_synopses.Bystander03: A frightened bystander on the ground floor of Moonrise Tower. He's deeply upset by the scrying eyes wandering the tower. He's caught between religious rapture and terror - he dreads and loves the Absolute in equal measure.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinsAfterExecution: The Bazaar Goblins talk among themselves after the execution scene.
