PAD_ReadResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_ReadResearch.text: Research on the nature of the shadow curse. Good to know.

session_synopses.PAD_ReadResearch: The player reads the journal of a dead druid in SCL. The druid was researching the Shadowcurse to see if it was spreading. After reading the journal the player rolls a Nature check to parse the notes

PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.speaker: Player
PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.text: That's odd. The flame won't go out.

PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.speaker: Player
PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.text: A spell - but not one I'm familiar with.

PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.speaker: Gale
PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.text: Must have been a wizard at work. I know a Continual Flame spell when I see one.

session_synopses.PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale: Party remarks on torches they cannot extinguish.

PAD_WantsOintment.speaker: Player
PAD_WantsOintment.text: Here we go - if there's any of that ointment left, I could use it.

PAD_WantsOintment.speaker: Player
PAD_WantsOintment.text: Same here. I don't want to face whatever's out there unprotected.

session_synopses.PAD_WantsOintment: PAD where a character who doesn't have the ointment applied steps into the shadowcurse and considers applying some. Only triggers if someone has spare ointment in their inventory. (At least one application)Plays only if 2 or more characters present: first to speak doesn't have the ointment applied on them. SH speaks first if she can.WRITER, don't forget to update the voicebark file SCL_ShadowCurse_VB_WantsOintment if you change the structure here!

VB_DirtpileGas.speaker: Player
VB_DirtpileGas.text: Argh! This air is foul with rot. Better be careful...

VB_Debilitated.speaker: Player
VB_Debilitated.text: This place... I feel chilled to the marrow.

PAD_Approach.speaker: Player
PAD_Approach.text: A dead bird. What happened to it?
PAD_Approach.context: NodeContext: Reacting to coming across a dead bird in the shadow-cursed lands.

session_synopses.PAD_Approach: A player encounters a dead bird.

HalfOrcCaster_AD_DriderDies.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_AD_DriderDies.text: Our guide is dead - and so are we if they take the lantern!

AD_Goblins_AtTower.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_Goblins_AtTower.text: Wonder if there's dancing down in the war camp. Feelin' frisky.
AD_Goblins_AtTower.context: NodeContext: Despite the playful phrase, makes it sound threatening.

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: Hold there! One step closer and -

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: True Soul - forgive me, I did not see you in the dark.

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Player
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: I could kill you for speaking to me like that.

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: If it was the Absolute's will.

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: But you had best wait until we get to Moonrise. Otherwise you might be missing a guide through the darkness.

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: Speak to me if you are ready to leave. Until then - welcome to the shadow curse.

session_synopses.AD_Goblins_AtTower: Goblins relaxing at Moonrise Towers after arriving with the Drider's caravan.
session_synopses.GoblinRanger_Dead: Speak with dead dialog with goblin ranger from the caravan. Only available if at the start of SCL Minthara is dead.

Raven_AD_GoBack.speaker: Raven
Raven_AD_GoBack.text: You found the ledger? Guess you're not so useless. Get back to master, on the double!

Raven.speaker: Narrator
Raven.text: *The raven looks at you with cold, dead eyes.*

Raven.speaker: Narrator
Raven.text: *You notice nothing out of the ordinary.*

Raven_AD_Bye.speaker: Raven
Raven_AD_Bye.text: I'd say bye, but you'll be dead soon! Hah!
Raven_AD_Bye.context: NodeContext: cruel and vicious, big laugh at the end

session_synopses.Raven_AD_GoBack: A brief AD ment to remind the player to go back to shadar kai.
session_synopses.AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat: Combat ADs for the Shadar Kai. Says one line at the start orf each of his turns.
session_synopses.Raven: You talk to a Raven in the shadow-cursed lands. Part of the Servant of the Raven booster.
session_synopses.AD_TakingTurn_002_Combat: Combat ADs for the Shadar Kai. Says one line at the start orf each of his turns.
session_synopses.Raven_AD_Bye: A concluding AD by the Raven when players completed the quest, before Raven disappears.

session_synopses.HQ_Plaque1: This is the narrator AD played on a plaque in HQ center in Shar temple - a slightly secluded area that the player needs to spot and jump into. It is a big hall with control maps, and books, dedicated to HQ gatherings, linking to other Sharran temples and societies

PAD_VoiceReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_VoiceReaction.text: A voice... is that Shar herself, who speaks...?

AD_Welcome.text: Welcome, child. Follow my voice, and prove your worth.

session_synopses.PAD_VoiceReaction: Party reacts to Shar's voice in the temple and acknowledging it is Shar's voice.
session_synopses.AD_Welcome: The player is welcomed to the Shar Temple by a disembodied voice

PAD_MintharaReaction.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
PAD_MintharaReaction.text: I wish I could kill that bloated sack of offal, but he may yet help us reach Ketheric.

AD_EnemyVulnerable.speaker: Balthazar
AD_EnemyVulnerable.text: We have the upper hand - do your work, Flesh!

AD_OrderingGhouls.speaker: Balthazar
AD_OrderingGhouls.text: Embalming fluid, and a pipette. Now.
AD_OrderingGhouls.context: NodeContext: Ordering his ghould minions about

AD_StartTurn.speaker: Balthazar
AD_StartTurn.text: It will be a kindness to put an end to your follies.

GolemInvitation.speaker: Flesh
GolemInvitation.context: CinematicNodeContext: The door to Balthazar's private chambers open, revealing a flesh golem. It utters a gurgle and beckons the player to enter.InternalNodeContext: Note - if the flesh golem is somehow unavailable, an alternate invitation will trigger with the necormancer instead.

AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_2.speaker: Justiciar Avenger
AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_2.context: NodeContext: Rasped, wraithlike battle taunt, directed at a trespassing necromancer

AD_LowHP.speaker: Balthazar
AD_LowHP.text: Fool. You think striking down my body will be the end of me?

session_synopses.PAD_MintharaReaction: When dialogue with Balthazar ends (or his projection that delivers the narrative bit) this PAD is played by Minthara in party.
session_synopses.AD_EnemyVulnerable: Balthazar orders his flesh golem to attack his enemy while they're vulnerable
session_synopses.AD_OrderingGhouls: Balthazar gives some orders to his ghouls while in the Shar temple. He tells them to fetch things related to his necromancy (he's busy repairing some of his undead troops)
session_synopses.AD_StartTurn: Balthazar gloats at and taunts the player before acting during his turn
session_synopses.AD_GolemDead: Balthazar is angry at his flesh golem being killed
session_synopses.GolemInvitation: Balthazar's private chambers are unlocked and his flesh golem invites the players inside to talk
session_synopses.AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_2: Justiciar that attacks Balthazar in his lair in Shar temple. Need to have same or similar voice to other Dark Justiciars
session_synopses.AD_Death: Balthazar's final words as he dies
session_synopses.PAD_DefeatedNecro: The players comment on Balthazar's death
session_synopses.FleshGolem: Short dialog where the player can interact with Balthazar's flesh golem. Incapable of speech, it utters a moaning sound.
session_synopses.AD_DominateGolem: Balthazar scolds his flesh golem as he calms it down
session_synopses.AD_LowHP: Balthazar defiantly reacts to being critically injured
session_synopses.AD_GhoulSnarl: One of the necromancer's ghoul servants barks a short, guttural warning if the player gets too close.

PAD_Ambush.speaker: Player
PAD_Ambush.context: NodeContext: Urgent/just been ambushed by a cloaker (a big bat/manta ray-looking creature)

session_synopses.PAD_Ambush: The party reacts to being ambushed by a Cloaker in the Gauntlet of Shar

JusticiarAppears.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A rat transforms into an elf. Its hisses and squeaks morph into the elf's cry of pain as he returns to his true form.

Keep the camera on the player while they react to the transformation

JusticiarAppears.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears.text: These hands... too big. Where are the others? Where's the rest of me?!
JusticiarAppears.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at his own hands in confusionNodeContext: Groan of pain followed by anger and confusion as he looks down at his own hands in disbelief

JusticiarAppears.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears.text: You - why did you have to keep prying? Why couldn't you just leave?!
JusticiarAppears.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks up from his hands to the player, angryNodeContext: Angry, irrational outburst. Looks up at the player on 'you'.

JusticiarAppears.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears.text: Lyrthindor - last Dark Justiciar. I kept watch over Lady Shar's temple. Kept the faith alive, after all the others were killed.

JusticiarAppears.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears.text: But you ruined it. Trespassed. Spoiled our - my - secret. Now you'll rot in the dark.
JusticiarAppears.context: NodeContext: Furious. Still mixed up, referring to himself in plural then correcting. Turns hostile immediately afterwards

JusticiarAppears.speaker: Player
JusticiarAppears.text: I'm sorry. What more can be said?

JusticiarAppears.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears.text: Nothing. You had your chance to talk - now you die.
JusticiarAppears.context: NodeContext: Furious. Turns hostile immediately afterwards

RatsNegotiate.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate.text: *The rat's beady eyes hold your gaze intently. What does it want?*

RatsNegotiate.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate.text: *The rat stares at you. It almost seems like it wants your attention.*

RatsNegotiate.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate.text: Scowl at the rat and shoo it away.

session_synopses.AD_UltimatumLure: The player can hear rats' squeaks and hisses coming from the bottom of the Shar Temple. This is meant to lure the player to the bottom of the temple.At this point the player has killed multiple rats and refused to negotiate with them.
session_synopses.JusticiarAppears: After killing the final rat during the Ultimatum stage, one of the final rats returns to its humanoid form as Lyrthindor,  the Last Justiciar. He's furious that the player has blown his cover, and quickly turns hostile.
session_synopses.RatsNegotiate: The player continues to kill the rats. The rats begin to group up and attempt to bargain with the player. Their memories are starting to converge into a single consciousness of the last dark justiciar. Some players who accepted a quest from the Orthon may realise there is a Dark Justiciar in hiding, amongst these rats. If the player repeatedly talks to the rats at this point without accepting a truce, they'll turn hostile.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.text: *The tangle of corpses gape at you lifelessly.*

Dead.speaker: Orthon's Bed
Dead.context: InternalNodeContext: processed voice with background sfx of a multitude wailing and moanin SwD has been cast on a pile of corpses forming the Orthon's bed.)NodeContext: Consumed with terror and agony.

session_synopses.Dead: Dialog used for casting the spell SwD on the Orthon's bed.Note that this bed is made up of numerous dead bodies when speaking, it should sound like there's a mass of souls wailing and moaning in the background as a primary corpse speaker delivers the lines.

AD.speaker: Yurgir
AD.text: Silence all prayers; smother each rite... blasted song!
AD.context: NodeContext: Singing to himself, with an exasperated outburst at the end

AD_MonitorLeaves.speaker: Raphael
AD_MonitorLeaves.context: NodeContext: annoyed, players just attacked him. He's unharmed, but teleports away, abandoning them

AD_FormLines.speaker: Yurgir
AD_FormLines.text: Form up ranks! Don't let anything get past you!
AD_FormLines.context: NodeContext: During combat. Bellowing orders to his merregon soldiers to change formation

AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase.speaker: Yurgir
AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase.text: Bravo - that almost stung. Perhaps I'll make a merregon of you, once you're dead.
AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase.context: NodeContext: Pronuncation: mer-eh-gone. Taunting, during combat. The player has injured the Orthon, who responds by changing up his tactics after this utterance.

AD_DisplacerGrowl.speaker: Displacer Beast
AD_DisplacerGrowl.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only. Displacer growl.NodeContext: SFX only. Displacer growl.

AD_VictimStand.speaker: Narrator
AD_VictimStand.text: *A foul totem of agony, mounted with sadistic relish.*

AD_KilledEnemy.speaker: Yurgir
AD_KilledEnemy.text: Another kill for me - aren't you embarrassed?!
AD_KilledEnemy.context: NodeContext: Battle taunt  on killing an opponent - 'that the best you have?'

session_synopses.AD: The Orthon mumble-sings to himself while idle in his lair in the Shar Temple. Occasionally he interrupts the lyrics with frustrated outbursts.This occurs after the ambush scene, where we learn that the song is his contract, and will remain stuck in his head until he fulfills the terms.
session_synopses.AD_MonitorLeaves: Raphael leaves while at the Orthon, in case he is attacked.
session_synopses.AD_FormLines: Orthon tells the merregons to get close to him during combat.
session_synopses.AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase: During combat, the orthon escalates to phase two (intensifying his attacks and changing up his tactics). This is prompted by:- killing a certain number of minions- lowering his HP a certain amount- surviving for a certain number of combat rounds
session_synopses.AD_DisplacerGrowl: The Displacer beast growls at the player if the player gets too close to it while it is in its idle behaviour if the Orthon is not hostile to the player.
session_synopses.AD_VictimStand: Narrator AD that pops up when clicking on Orthons's victims on display in Shar temple. They are pretty different so text needs to be universally fitting.
session_synopses.AD_KilledEnemy: The Orthon's shouts upon killing a (non-summon) enemy. Taunting and belittling his opponents, claiming they pose no challenge.

PAD_DarkJusticiar.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiar.text: Countless initiates walked these halls once, seeking to become Dark Justiciars.

PAD_DarkJusticiar.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiar.text: I will follow in their path. I will succeed.

PAD_PathOfDarknessHint.speaker: Player
PAD_PathOfDarknessHint.text: This must be what that book meant. I need to get across - and that means remembering where these platforms are.

PAD_ShadowheartIntro.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartIntro.text: I shall prove myself worthy, Lady Shar.

PAD_TeleportedByShadow.speaker: Player
PAD_TeleportedByShadow.text: Damn. That shade knocked me right back to the start.

PAD_DontHaveGem.speaker: Player
PAD_DontHaveGem.text: Don't have anything to put here.

PAD_SpotGem.speaker: Player
PAD_SpotGem.text: A gem. Looks like it might fit in the altar from before.
PAD_SpotGem.context: NodeContext: Karlach note: open to interpretation (to mean 'hey, I spotted it!)  but inspired by jimmy durante

session_synopses.PAD_DarkJusticiar: Shadowheart is walking along the corridors of the trials and is clearly excited about the prospect of finally proving herself worthy.
session_synopses.PAD_ObjectOfDarknessPlaque: The player discovers the name of the Shar trial.
session_synopses.PAD_PathOfDarknessHint: The player comments after possibly figuring out a clue to successfully completing one of the trials in the Temple of Shar. They must safely cross the room while remembering where the platforms along the way are.
session_synopses.PAD_TortureRoomPlaque: The player discovers the name of the Shar trial.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartIntro: Shadowheart answers the Shar statue with affirmation.
session_synopses.PAD_TeleportedByShadow: A player was seen by a ghost while attempting the sneaking trial in the Shar Temple and teleported back to the beginning of the trial.
session_synopses.PAD_DontHaveGem: The player attempts to place a Sharran gem in the temple puzzle, but they do not have one.
session_synopses.PAD_SpotGem: The player notices one of the Trial Gems and points it out. If the player knows that the altar requires the gems, they will reiterate the gem's use. Reactivity for finding additional gems subsequently.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Another bowl, bearing the stains of an ancient blood offering.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks at a large bowl being held by a Shar statue. Close-up of a dried blood stain in the base of the bowl.

session_synopses: For when a player interacts with the statue to begin the stealth trial in the Shar temple.

AD_Plaque.speaker: Narrator
AD_Plaque.text: *Feed your bodies and rest your minds. Lady Shar needs her warriors strong and ready.*
AD_Plaque.context: NodeContext: Plaque text at barracks/dining hall of a Shar temple

session_synopses.AD_Plaque: This is a plaque placed in the section of barracks and dining halls and altar in Shar temple. Wise words to acolytes to have priestine thoughts and behavior

NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.speaker: Balthazar
NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.text: A cheap attack, just as I'm finally reunited with my masterwork? This will not stand.
NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.context: InternalNodeContext: Balthazar is hostile to the player as they attacked him before the normal scene flow triggered.NodeContext: Furious.

session_synopses.NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro: Balthazar responds to the player's attack before becoming hostile

PAD_TriggeredShadows.speaker: Player
PAD_TriggeredShadows.text: So cold... there's something coming. I can feel it in the shadows...
PAD_TriggeredShadows.context: InternalNodeContext: Triggers after the player is teleported into the corpse pit in the Shar Temple.NodeContext: Dread and unease.

session_synopses.PAD_TriggeredShadows: After being teleported into a pit filled with bones, the player notices shadows gathering around them as the air gets colder. The player should feel a sense of dread

PAD_SpearLoot.speaker: Player
PAD_SpearLoot.text: This is no common spear... It must be the one that Shadowheart is supposed to find.

AD_SilencePlayer.context: NodeContext: Creepy ghost-whisper, spoken in combat.

session_synopses.PAD_OpenedScrollDoor: Party expresses affirmation that the button opened the door.
session_synopses.PAD_SpearLoot: Voicebark when picking up the Spear of the Night. A sacred Sharran relic and vital for Shadowheart's quest to kill Nightsong.
session_synopses.AD_SilencePlayer: Combat reaction for the Dark Justiciar ghosts in the Silent Library. When the player disturbs them they will silence the player . On the third disturbance they become hostile
session_synopses.AD_RiddlePlaque: Reads out the riddle on the plaque.

PAD_Prayer.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Prayer.text: Just a little bit farther. See my actions, Lady Shar. Hear my words of faith.
PAD_Prayer.context: NodeContext: Urging herself on. Final descent

AD_MartialPlaque.speaker: Narrator
AD_MartialPlaque.text: *Deliver the Night Mother's mercy upon her enemies.*

AD_NecroUnavailable.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroUnavailable.text: I smell the stink of Balthazar. Bring him to me.
AD_NecroUnavailable.context: NodeContext: She can do an ostentatiouse 'sniff' sound like a pro wrestler insulting an enemy

AD_EntrancePlaque.speaker: Narrator
AD_EntrancePlaque.text: *Spill the blood of SelÃ»ne and rise a warrior of Shar.*
AD_EntrancePlaque.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player didn't already know Nightsong was a living beingNodeContext: The text of a plaque, instructing initiates in a sharran rite.

ArriveAtShadowfell.speaker: Shadowheart
ArriveAtShadowfell.text: Lady Shar... I can feel her all around. This is her domain. This is the Shadowfell.

ArriveAtShadowfell.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell.text: You cleared the way for me, True Soul. What promising flesh you are. As a reward, I shall let you bear witness to my masterpiece.
ArriveAtShadowfell.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Please restrict hip and leg movement for this line. He will be floating as he speaks.

Balthazar appears behind the player through the entrance from Shar Temple to Nightsong's prison. He's levitating and reaches their side before they can react, InternalNodeContext: Fallback - haven't met balthazar in person or agreed to helpNodeContext: High-handed, pleased with himself

ArriveAtShadowfell.speaker: Shadowheart
ArriveAtShadowfell.text: This is the Dark Lady's domain - he does not belong here.
ArriveAtShadowfell.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player re: Balthazar. Disdain.

AD_Plaque3.speaker: Narrator
AD_Plaque3.text: *In her blood be anointed: Dark Justiciar.*

PAD_EnteredShadowfell.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteredShadowfell.text: I feel lighter, unburdened, as if the softest push could send me drifting away.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong.text: Balthazar. Come to add more bars to my cage.
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong.text: Or perhaps to lead this would-be Justiciar's blade directly to my heart?
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext:  On "this Justiciar"," abruptly turns to the player and points an accusing finger. As she moves forward out of position, magical hands grab around her wrists arms and shoulers, holding her back. She looks down at them and grimaces in rage, then steps back into place. This is how she's bound: If she moves too far, she'll be pulled back by the magi-hands.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong.text: I invite you: heap more sins upon your head. My retribution will be all the sweeter for them.
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stock still. Cold. Staring Balthazar dead in the eyes.NodeContext: With a deep, seething foreboding

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong.text: All this time, and you still fail to appreciate the gifts I bestowed on you, Aylin. Sad, to see a thing of beauty not recognise its own worth.
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext: Displeased poutNodeContext: A little displeased and admonishing

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong.text: But General Thorm - he appreciates you. And he wants you close at hand, so I am here to whisk you back to him.
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brightening upNodeContext: Tone brightening up a little

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong.text: Ketheric. I welcome the sight of him, after these hundred years. He whose immortality I supply with my very soul.
NecroAndNightsong.context: NodeContext: She spits on the floor of her cage after 'Ketheric'

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong.text: General. Thorm. I'm sure you'll be on your best behaviour for him. But just in case, I've taken some precautions.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong.text: Keep back. It will take quite some concentration to secure Aylin for her little journey.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Shadowheart
NecroAndNightsong.text: The Nightsong is Shar's sacrifice - she's my destiny. He cannot have her!
NecroAndNightsong.context: NodeContext: Urgent. Her sacred mission is in jeopardy

PAD_ShadowfellEntrance.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowfellEntrance.text: This must be where initiates undertook their final preparations. The end is near.
PAD_ShadowfellEntrance.context: NodeContext: Focus/mounting anticipation. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction.context:
NodeContext: Karlach: High derision. She doesn't support what just happened.
Halsin - bitter

PAD_NightsongsFateReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongsFateReaction.text: I hope your goddess is pleased.

PAD_ShadowheartBaptism.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBaptism.text: Almost there. I will not fail you, my lady.
PAD_ShadowheartBaptism.context: NodeContext: Quiet determination. Nearing the end of Shar's trials

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1.text: The blood of SelÃ»ne? I was expecting we'd find this Nightsong relic, not some sacrifice.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2.text: Alive - and abandoned in this place for a very long time.

PAD_FalseNightSpear.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_FalseNightSpear.text: Used by initiates for the final step to becoming Dark Justiciar... not all were worthy of the Spear of Night, it seems.
PAD_FalseNightSpear.context: NodeContext: Considering a ceremonial spear. Uncanny insight. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

NightsongFreed.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed.text:
Our Lady of Silver. Hear me!
She Who Guides, the Moonmaiden SelÃ»ne -
MOTHER OF THE SO-CALLED NIGHTSONG.
THE NIGHTSONG IS NO MORE!
NightsongFreed.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She kneels, head down, allowing the player to lay a hand upon her shoulder. As the hand makes contact, the hands appear upon her again - they glow and burs/ fade awayt. She steps forward nervously and stumbles, not having been free in a century and momentarily dizzied by the prospect of it. She catches herself on hand and knees, her head hanging. She begins to beat the ground with a fist in a slow, powerful rhythm. Then, she begins to hum an ancient, almost Gregorian chant. As she hums, the sound of it echoing through the Shadowfell builds and morphs into a chorus humming in harmony with her. She raises herself to her feet, but the rhythm continues, as does the song, independently of her.

As the music swells, Nightsong raises her voice in an invocation
NodeContext: Shouted to the heavens.

NightsongFreed.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongFreed.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A moonbeam lands on Nightsong, like a spotlight. She begins to glow as the music swells and reaches its climax.
Within the moonbeam, she transforms. Her wounds heal, and her rusted, dirty armour and torn clothes begin to mend.
The ragged, violently marred costume she was wearing is replaced, piece by piece, with the shining armour of a paladin of Selune.The spotlight on Nightsong fades. She is renewed, beautiful, powerful.

NodeContext: With joy and gratitiude. Not ego, but fact.

AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting.context: NodeContext: whispered prayer/recitation, delivered by a spectral figure

session_synopses.PAD_Prayer: Shadowheart recites verses of a prayer to Shar as she draws closer to Nightsong.This is a prayer that SH may have recited previously, now repeated as SH gets past the final hurdles to fulfill Shar's bidding. Urging herself on for the 'final lap'.
session_synopses.AD_Plaque2: This is a plaque with narrator AD near the soul cage - before the final trial of killing the Selunite to finish Dark Justiciar training. There are total 3 of them so information needs to be divided nicely.
session_synopses.AD_MartialPlaque: Narrator AD to read what is out on the plaque.
session_synopses.AD_NecroUnavailable: Nightsong indicates to the player that she cannot talk while Balthazar is unavailable
session_synopses.AD_EntrancePlaque: The player reads the plaque outside Nightsong's chamber. It instructs them to kill Nightsong in order to become a Dark Justiciar
session_synopses.ArriveAtShadowfell: After the player arrives at Nightsong's prison in the Shadowfell we see Balthazar show up, hot on the player's heels. Balthazar makes his way down towards Nightsong. Variant lines for:1. Met Balthazar in person, agreed to help2. Met Balthazar in person, didn't agree to help 3. Fallback (likely skipped meeting Balthazar)If Balthazar is dead then the player is just shown a cinematic shot of the Shadowfell
session_synopses.AD_Plaque3: This is a plaque with narrator AD near the soul cage - before the final trial of killing the Selunite to finish Dark Justiciar training. There are total 3 of them so information needs to be divided nicely.
session_synopses.PAD_EnteredShadowfell: PAD that plays after the end the cinematic upon entering the shadowfell in Nightsong's prison. Calls out to the player that they can jump down to the platforms below safely.
session_synopses.NecroAndNightsong: If Balthazar is alive when the player reaches Nightsong, they will encounter a dialogue where Balthazar and Nightsong square off. The player has one last chance to betray Balthazar and prevent him from taking Nightsong to Moonrise.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowfellEntrance: Entered the final hall before entering the shadowfell in the shar temple. The area used to be used for Dark Justiciars to wash themselves, conduct last prayers and arming themselves before entering the waters into the shadowfell.
session_synopses.PAD_NightsongsFateReaction: PAD that plays after the players have finished the Nightsong Rtual situation in the Shadowfell.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBaptism: Shadowheart's response to SHA_VoiceOfShar_AD_Baptism if she is nearby. Reaffirming her dedication to become a Dark Justiciar
session_synopses.PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1: The player has read the plaque outside the entrance to Nightsong's Prison and are reacting appropriately:- if they are Shadowheart and have Shar's spear- if they are Shadowheart and do not have Shar's spear- if they already knew Nightsong was a person- if they did not know Nightsong was a person
session_synopses.PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2: The player has read the plaque outside the entrance to Nightsong's Prison and the characters are reacting appropriately:- discovering Nightsong is a living being for the first time- confirming that same fact after learning it elsewhere- if Shadowheart, iterating her desire to sacrifice Nightsong/retrieve the spear required to do so.- reacting to Shadowheartâ€™s desire to sacrifice Nightsong to Shar, with variables depending on if theyâ€™re just learning Nightsong is a living being here or not.
session_synopses.PAD_FalseNightSpear: Looted fake spear of the night. Used by old justiciars to symbolically kill Nightsong.
session_synopses.NightsongFreed: After the players free Nightsong she is returned to her former glory
session_synopses.AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting: The Dark Justiciars in Nightsong's Prison can be found nonverbally chanting

CINE_NightsongsFlight.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide shot of a figure arcing up into sky high above the temple, trailing pure white light. Close-up as Nightsong surveys the shadow-lands, the light intensifying around her as her rage builds. She swoops down, light spreading in her wake as she gathers speed. CU on an overgrown ruin in SCL. Where Nightsong passes, colour and contrast leak back in as the shadows part.

CinematicNodeContext: Isobel at a window in Last Light, a glow touching her face as she looks up in wonder.
Shot from her POV: Nightsong like a shooting star, opening up a path of light as she streaks towards Moonrise.

AD_TauntPlayer.speaker: Nightsong
AD_TauntPlayer.text: What are you afraid of? Your own wicked heart?

session_synopses.CINE_NightsongsFlight: After the player frees Nightsong we see her fly towards Moonrise to confront Ketheric. She passes over Last Light, where Isobel or Jaheira observe her flight from a window.
session_synopses.AD_TauntPlayer: Nightsong tries to goad the player into killing her

AD_TurnsAgainstPlayerResponse.speaker: Player
AD_TurnsAgainstPlayerResponse.text: Not keen on fighting its allies. Should've figured.

session_synopses.AD_TurnsAgainstPlayerResponse: Player summons flesh golem but the player's enemies are the golem's allies. Player character comments on this to clarify this to the actual player

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A small prickle of dread finds your heart as you look upon the altar.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands before an altar of Shar.

session_synopses: The player discovers an altar in the temple of Shar. They can choose to pray at it, with the chance to receive a buff or debuff depending on the outcome of a religion check. Shar and Selune tags automatically get buff and debuff respectively. Avatar Shadowheart gets a unique and ambigous outcome, casting some doubt on her standing with her goddess.

PAD_MyrkulSymbol.speaker: Player
PAD_MyrkulSymbol.text: What is that symbol supposed to mean?

PAD_MakeshiftVessel.speaker: Player
PAD_MakeshiftVessel.text: What is that? Almost looks like someone was trying to grow a person.

PAD_Mural_002.speaker: Player
PAD_Mural_002.text: Ketheric Thorm, leading Shar's forces. Quite the about-face for a warrior of SelÃ»ne.

PAD_KethericsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_KethericsMap.text: Looks like there's a temple under this place - and something deadly sealed inside it.

AD_IsobelsPlaque.speaker: Narrator
AD_IsobelsPlaque.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at a plaque on the side of Isobel's tomb.NodeContext: Ssussun elgg oloth (SUSS-sun ELL-gh OL-oth) - Elvish for "Light slays darkness."

CINE_DescendingIntoTemple.context:
CinematicNodeContext: After interacting with the teleportation stone the player reacts as the large elevator disc sets into motion and starts a long desent into darkness.

NOTE: on subsequent uses of the elevator, a fade to black will be done via script.InternalNodeContext: Occurs the first time the player uses the elevator/disc linking the Thorm mausoleum in SCL to the Shar Temple.
NOTE: on subsequent uses of the elevator, a fade to black will be done via script.

PAD_FoundDisc.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDisc.text: That disc looks like it can move - but where does it lead?

PAD_NecromancersRoom.speaker: Player
PAD_NecromancersRoom.text: Bones everywhere... Someone's been engaging in dark rituals here.
PAD_NecromancersRoom.context: NodeContext: Astarion; as in 'water water everywhere, but not a drop to drink' (referring to a large amount of skeletons on display in a tomb

PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.speaker: Narrator
PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.text: *Here lies Melodia Thorm, beloved wife and mother. Ai armiel telere maenen hir.*
PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.context: NodeContext: Ah-less-ia /  Ay Army-el Teller-eh Man-en here

session_synopses.PAD_MyrkulSymbol: Players enter the room where the symbol of Myrkul lies on the floor. Hard religion DC before the PAD plays.
session_synopses.PAD_MakeshiftVessel: Players find a vessel with a half-formed humanoid shape gestating inside and reacts accordingly. The being is just inert flesh and cannot speak.
session_synopses.PAD_Mural_002: Player interacts with the third mural of the Mausoleum puzzle and get the final piece of the story. This mural depicts Ketheric Thorm, along with a Sharran army, standing before the corrupted version of Moonrise Towers. Player response varies, depending on if they've seen Ketheric or not. (note: do NOT refer to Moonrise towers by name in these responses, as awareness is not guaranteed)
session_synopses.PAD_KethericsMap: Players find the map Ketheric had inside the mausoleum. It shows  the entrance to the Shar Temple (behind Isobel's tomb) and has notes on an attack.
session_synopses.AD_IsobelsPlaque: Narrator/player to reading the plaque on Isobel's tomb . If they already know Isobel is Ketheric's daughter, the narrator reaction is different. The Elvish translates to 'Light slays darkness'.Note: the unusual structure of this is because the Origin PAD template is a greeting node and can't be connected to normally.
session_synopses.CINE_DescendingIntoTemple: Cinematic of players descending into the temple after jumping for the first time on the disc towards the temple.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundDisc: Players find the disc at the mausoleum that leads to the Shar temple.
session_synopses.PAD_NecromancersRoom: Players enter for the first time inside the necromancer's room at the mausoleum. Bones are scattered about and arranged into strange totems, in a sign someone has been dabbling in dark magic.
session_synopses.PAD_KethericsWifePlaque: Reaction from player/narrator who interacts with the tomb of Isobel's mother (and Ketheric's wife).

Altar.speaker: Shadowheart
Altar.text: There's nothing more for us to do here - not until we complete Lady Shar's trials.

PAD_ShadowheartVista.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartVista.text: Lady Shar... so many must have toiled to make a visage so grand. It's beautiful...
PAD_ShadowheartVista.context: NodeContext: Overawed at the sight of a statue of liberty-sized representation of Shar, in  the heart of a huge temple.

session_synopses.Altar: The player approaches an altar dedicated to Shar. This altar is a call to action for the player to complete Shar's trials and become a Dark Justiciar.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartVista: Shadowheart sees the giant Shar Statue and lets it set in that she is in the temple of shar.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The bowl contains an ancient, rust-coloured bloodstain. It forms a neat disc, as if spilled calmly and willingly.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks at a large bowl being held by a Shar statue.  Close-up of a dried blood stain in the base of the bowl.

session_synopses: For when a player interacts with the trial statue to being the path of darkness/invisible platform trial.

PAD_ShadowheartReturns.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartReturns.context: NodeContext: Pained/dazed/contrite. Has just been made an outcast by her goddess and forcibly ejected from her realm.

PAD_ShadowheartReturns.speaker: Player
PAD_ShadowheartReturns.text: Shadowheart? What happened? You were missing for a moment.
PAD_ShadowheartReturns.context: NodeContext: Alarmed. The companion vanished on teleporting out of a place, only to reappear in a confused, distress state.

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartReturns: The party reacts to Shadowheart's delayed return from the Shadowfell - Shar held her back to punish her for not killing Nightsong.

PAD_Welcomed.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Welcomed.text: I hear you, Lady Shar. I shall not fail.

PAD_PushedByRing.speaker: Player
PAD_PushedByRing.text: Almost made it that time - just have to watch my step.
PAD_PushedByRing.context: NodeContext: Just been repulsed by an invisible kinetic force that threw them a few feet backwards.

AD_Mirrors.speaker: Narrator
AD_Mirrors.text: *The mirrors here seem to not reflect light, but devour it.*

session_synopses.PAD_Welcomed: Shadowheart answers in kind to SHA_VoiceOfShar_AD_Welcome
session_synopses.PAD_PushedByRing: Player reacts to being pushed by the rings in the crypt of the Shar temple.
session_synopses.AD_Mirrors: Narrator AD on smaller mirrors in SHA temple. Player can mention there is something magical about them, instead of just reflection of surrounding world. There are couple of them in the temple

AD_ScoutsRetreat.text: You tread where you are not wanted - leave.
AD_ScoutsRetreat.context: NodeContext: Raspy, undead. Warning off an exploring player
NodeContext: Raspy, undead. Alarm, supernaturally sensing danger (in the broader region of a large underground temple rather than right before them)

Scouts.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Scouts.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on Skeleton 000 (speaking)NodeContext: Terse, rising anger

Scouts.speaker: Narrator
Scouts.text: *Your mind upends. Somehow, in the decayed soup of this creature's brain, a tadpole lives. Another presence nurtures it, manipulates it like a puppet.*

Scouts.speaker: Shadowheart
Scouts.text: And you do? I won't allow some walking, talking feast for stray dogs where I belong or not.

Scouts.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Scouts.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on Skeleton 001 (speaking)

Please reduce the transitioning into and out of line. The Skelton should appear as if subtly breathing in life. He's currently feeling like robot batteries running out.  Keep delivery closer to S_SHA_TadpoledSkeletons_Skelly_000.NodeContext: Terse, rising anger (building from 000's line)

Scouts.speaker: Reconstituted Marksman
Scouts.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on Skeleton 002 (speaking)NodeContext: Terse, rising anger (building from 001's line)

Scouts.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Scouts.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on Skeleton 000 (speaking)NodeContext: Terse, rising anger (building from 002's line)

Scouts.speaker: Player
Scouts.text: You leave. I don't answer to bone piles.

Scouts.speaker: Reconstituted Marksman
Scouts.text: Bones? They are more than bones.

Please reduce the transitioning into and out of line. The Skelton should appear as if subtly breathing in life. He's currently feeling like robot batteries running out.  Keep delivery closer to S_SHA_TadpoledSkeletons_Skelly_000.NodeContext: Hint of pride and indignation

Scouts.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist

Scouts.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on Skeleton 000 (speaking)NodeContext: Breaks off before finishing sentence - sensing something. Full sentence would have been 'before you attract trouble'

session_synopses.AD_ScoutsRetreat: The Tadpoled Skeleton Scouts spot the player and give them a brief warning before noticing the Shadowquake and running
session_synopses.Scouts: Player meets the skeletons controlled by Balthazar, the Necromancer, who is barricaded elsewhere in the temple. His skeletons meet the player in the hallway. The skeletons sense an attack and retreat to help defend the necromancer.The skeletons speak individually, in turns, but are all the mouthpieces of Balthazar, the necromancer. NOTE: the three skeletal voices/speakers can differ, but should flow in terms of tone as though they're ultimately coming from the one person - transmitting his words.

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: What was that? I feel strange... clear.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You only love your master because he's been dosing this meat. He's manipulating you.
True

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: I remember... quick flesh, hot blood.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: The beast is initially outraged, but your logic is infallible, and awakens thoughts and feelings it has buried for a long time with the help of the charm potion.

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: Before master, my prey was alive.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Anger brewing

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: False master! Hind-legged liars, all! I'll shred you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Irrational with rage, extremely triggered

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Stop your mewling before I shred you.
False

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: I don't answer to you, prey.

session_synopses: Appears if the player tries to speak to the Displacer Beast. The player can learn that the beast is in love with the Orthon, and if they know that it has been charmed by him, they can attempt to convince it to join them in battle against the Orthon.

PAD_2P.speaker: Player
PAD_2P.text: Prayers, charms, battle cries - the Harpers' work. They were primed for combat.

PAD_2P.speaker: Player
PAD_2P.text: A commemoration of battles long past. Like the town itself.

session_synopses.PAD_2P: AD about a wall with protective charms and prayers written by Harpers attacking Ketheric's Outpost.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text:
*Here - House of Healing
West - Baldur's Gate
East - Central Square*

Brewer_Zombie_01.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01.text: D-do mess our pardon. Our master d-distiller spill's quite the caused.

Brewer_Zombie_01.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01.text: Now settle your mind, chum, and get your shine on. Be will it what?

Brewer_Zombie_01.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01.text: M-moon Mountain Dark, coming righ-righ-right up. A man of proper t-taste!
Brewer_Zombie_01.context: NodeContext: Stuck on repeat, going through the motions and 'glitching out'.

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *Research notes. They describe a powerful venom extracted from a rare purple worm. Distiller Thisobald Thorm sought to create a fatal poison using the worm's gullet.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *He procured several parts of a gullet, but rinsed one in error. The poison he brewed was noxious - but not fatal.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *He devoted months to formulating a deadly poison with the remaining ingredients, without success.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *After exhaustive experimentation, he was able to make a near-deadly extract from the glands. But to complete his poison, Thisobald required one last ingredient:*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *The book's index reveals corpse roses may grow near tombs, mausoleums, and particularly redolent cadavers.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *Thisobald enlisted a courier from Baldur's Gate to obtain corpse rose petals and other ingredients and deliver them to a covert location.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *Unfortunately, a deep purple stain darkens the final page, obscuring the parcel's destination.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Player
ResearchNotes.text: Focus your eyes on the page. Mentally separate the blank ink from the purple stain.

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *Your mind separates the black from the blue, revealing the stash's location. You mark your map as a reminder.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *With the corpse rose petals the package contains, you might create Thisobald's purple worm poison.*

PAD_Brewer_Poison.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_Poison.text: Hells - his brew's turned to poison.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_02.speaker: Blighted Patron
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02.text: Finally, there might be some more drink for the rest of us.
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02.context: NodeContext: reflecting on the fact the brewer just died, but with little emotion

AD_Brewer_Zombie_03.speaker: Blighted Troubador
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03.text: Drink has torn his mortal stitches - Say, hey, for the pub!
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03.context: NodeContext: referring to the brewer, who just died

AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_001_Combat.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_001_Combat.text: Imps! No, no - illusions, delusions, delirium.

PAD_Entrance_1P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P.text: That sign above. This must be a brewery - or distillery.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Blighted Actor
AD_Brewer_Zombie_04.text: Wait... what am I doing here again?

AD_Brewer_Necro_Combat.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Necro_Combat.text: Drink of dead, dying, death. Order up.

PAD_ArmInBarrel.speaker: Player
PAD_ArmInBarrel.text: Is that... a human arm? Do I even want to know?

PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating.text: Is that... yes! His hallucinations made real.

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: One day I'll get there... one day...

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: What are you doing up here on this stage?

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: Isn't it obvious! I'm a... I stand on a stage, pretending...
Brewer_Zombie_04.context: NodeContext: hesitant, trying to find the right words, but is cursed to forget

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: You mean you're an actor? How did you end up here?

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: I was... performing... and then the lights went out. I'm waiting for the curtain call.

Brewer.context: CinematicNodeContext: The brewer drags itself to a bar counter, on which are two full mugs.

Brewer.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer.text: Drink, gulp it down, wet your whistle. Tell your story.
Brewer.context: NodeContext: Twisted and creepy, a jovial barman who has been corrupted by curse.

Brewer.speaker: Player
Brewer.text: What in all Nine Hells are you?

Brewer.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer.text: Son of Thorm. Sot of Sword Coast.

Brewer.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer.text: Go on. Cheers, bottoms up, down the hatch.
Brewer.context: NodeContext: still an offer, but becoming more of a threat

AD_Brewer_Drunk_002_Combat.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Drunk_002_Combat.text: Too much drink. Too much drunk.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_01.speaker: Blighted Barman
AD_Brewer_Zombie_01.text: Sorry terrible, I'll c-c-clean up right mess that.
AD_Brewer_Zombie_01.context: NodeContext: referring to the fact the brewer just died - quietly amused

session_synopses.Brewer_Zombie_01: A zombie who was once the waiter. He is stuck on repeat, going through the motions and 'glitching out'.
session_synopses.ResearchNotes: Research notes of the Brewer.He experimented with different poisons on different creatures, trying to figure out the most effective ways of poisoning them. This book also contains info about his attempts to create a Purple Worm Poison.
session_synopses.PAD_Brewer_Poison: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
session_synopses.AD_Brewer_Zombie_02: One of the zombie patrons in the Brewery. Just wandering around.He's been trapped in the shadow-curse for a hundred years, and has been drained of most of his emotions. What lingers is a sense of sadness - he misses the joy of the old times.
session_synopses.AD_Brewer_Zombie_03: Zombie Patron #3 in BreweryTroubador singing/chanting drinking rhymes.
session_synopses.AD_HalflingsSign: Plaque that says "Halfings and gnomes order here."
session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_1P: VB that is played when you approach the Distillery in SCL
session_synopses.AD_Brewer: Brewer in Shadow-Cursed Town. Waiting for someone to join him as he stands behind the bar.The brewer was once an ordinary person, but has been twisted by the shadowcurse and is now a huge, bloated monstrosity. He speaks in fragments, and is menacing but with an air of melancholy. He wants to drink until he forgets everything, and would like to bring everyone into oblivion with him.
session_synopses.AD_WaningMoonSign: Click on the sign of Distillery in TWN
session_synopses.AD_Brewer_Zombie_04: Zombie Patron #4 in Brewery. Used to be an actor, was on her way to Baldur's Gate. Like the other patrons in the brewery, she's been trapped in the shadow-curse for a hundred years, and is mostly drained of emotions.
session_synopses.PAD_ArmInBarrel: There is a barrel with an arm sticking out of it, Clicking on it makes the characters comment. The comment is different depending on whether the player has read the Brewer's diary.
session_synopses.PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
session_synopses.Brewer_Zombie_04: One of the zombie patrons in the Brewery. This is an actor whose heart was set on the Five Flagons in Baldur's Gate, but he got lost in his cups here.
session_synopses.Brewer: Dialog with the Brewer. He is a bloated creature who asks us to drink ourselves into oblivion with him. Player choices lead either to combat, or to the brewer drinking himself until he explodes.Twisted and creepy, a jovial barman who has been corrupted by curse to become a monstrous drunk. He speaks in fragments, swinging between melancholy, menace, and humour. Extra emphasis and derangment on bold words.
session_synopses.AD_Brewer_Zombie_01: Zomie waiter going through the motions, glitching out in a way, his words are all out of order.

AD_DeadGithyankiBodyWithMap.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_DeadGithyankiBodyWithMap.text: A dead githyanki. The corpse may hold something useful.

session_synopses.AD_DeadGithyankiBodyWithMap: Laezel directs the player's attention to the dead body.

Korrilla.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla.text: Tr-tread carefully. You are still... necessary.
Korrilla.context: NodeContext: the ellipses and hyphens here are to denote her struggling to get the words out as she's afflicted with shadowcurse

session_synopses.Korrilla: This is a fallback one-liner. In case the Player manages to approach her an initiate dialog in TWN, Korrilla gives a cryptic one-liner to the player. No Hasmet node is needed, as she teleports away right after.She would be struggling with the shadow curse as she says this line.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text:
*Here - The Waning Moon
North - Central Square
East - Reithwin Tollhouse*

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.context: NodeContext: RYTH-win. Like rye bread, not wreath. TH like in 'thick', not like in 'those'.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text: *Reithwin House of Healing. Presiding Surgeon: Malus Thorm.*

AD_Surgeon_SuccessfulSurgery_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_SuccessfulSurgery_Combat.text: A successful procedure, Shar be praised!

AD_Surgeon_Leech_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Leech_Combat.text: Behold - the leech, for draining humours most foul.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_002_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_002_Combat.text: The subject resists. Next instrument, good sister.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: You're not sick, not sick at all. Wait in line.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Here to see the doctor? Are we poorly? Are we desperately poorly?

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Not so well. But well enough to wait. Join the line, and you will be seen.
Reception_Receptionist.context: CinematicNodeContext: The nurse 'looks' you over, assessing your condition.InternalNodeContext: Upon investigation, deduces that you're not that sick.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist.text: No thanks, I'll take my chances out there.

ZealousAssistant_003_AD.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD.text: Can you feel it? The hurting?

ZealousAssistant_003_AD.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003_AD.text: Here, darling. Let me soothe the pain.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_004_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_004_Combat.text: This flesh must be flayed. The next instrument, sister.

Reception_CorpseTender.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender.text: Don't call the doctor yet! I've got potions, sutures - I know I can do this...
Reception_CorpseTender.context: InternalNodeContext: She doesn't see you coming, but from the sound of your footsteps thinks you might be the doctor. NodeContext: The nurse is panicking assuming you are a patient

Reception_CorpseTender.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender.text: Oh, you're a patient. This is the children's ward - triage is back that way.
Reception_CorpseTender.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mid-inspection, the nurse notices you. NodeContext: Mid-inspection, the nurse notices the player.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_001_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_001_Combat.text: Sister. The first instrument, if I may.

AD_Surgeon_Trepan_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Trepan_Combat.text: Blood has pooled in the brain. I must open the cranium!

ZealousAssistant_001_AD.speaker: Sister Geanne
ZealousAssistant_001_AD.text: He is absent. Abscence is him.
ZealousAssistant_001_AD.context: NodeContext: Weird outbursts. Her mind is lost. Not loud, just intense

Patient_AD.speaker: Distressed Patient
Patient_AD.context: NodeContext: Gurgling - tongue has been torn out

AD_Surgeon.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon.text: Only with unwavering hand can we show our subject mercy.
AD_Surgeon.context: NodeContext: speaking to nurses as he demonstrates surgical procedure

ZealousAssistant_000_AD.speaker: Sister Hunna
ZealousAssistant_000_AD.text: The gift of... nothing. Her gift.
ZealousAssistant_000_AD.context: NodeContext: Her mind is gone. She should sound haunting.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_003_Combat.speaker: Sister Anya
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_003_Combat.context: NodeContext: 'Sister?' = expectantly, asking for his next surgical tool.

PAD_Entrance_2P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_2P.text: A house of healing, from the looks of it.

PAD_Entrance_2P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_2P.text: Good news for us. There could be some useful potions inside.

AD_Surgeon_Bonesaw_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Bonesaw_Combat.text: Still yourself. The saw's teeth will open the way for her shadow.

RooftopRaven.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven.text: |H... Hi? What are you doing at my home?|

RooftopRaven.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven.text: |This literally is just a rooftop though? I just stumbled into you|

RooftopRaven.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven.text: |Yeah. But I still live here. And you're invading on my living space|

RooftopRaven.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven.text: |Oh, I see there are some cool ingredients you have lying around? I'd really like to discuss those!|

RooftopRaven.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven.text: |Those are MINE! Don't come any closer to them!|

session_synopses.PAD_SurgeonDead: PAD is played after Surgeon is dead.Variations: - Killed by Nurses; - Killed himself; - Killed in combat;
session_synopses.Reception_Receptionist: Receptionist at the entrance of the Hospital. She's mostly supposed to be there for flavor and to provide directions to the operating room (down the hallway and under the observation area.) If you piss her off or try to circumvent her to see the doctor, she'll fight you.
session_synopses.ZealousAssistant_003_AD: Nurses only speak if the Surgeon is dead.Case #1 They operated on the Surgeon and killed him.Case #2.The player killed the Surgeon and ran away. The nurses now have ADs.
session_synopses.ZealousAssistant_002: One of the nurses in the HospitalMUTE (maybe just can't talk or maybe lost her tongue to the surgeon)
session_synopses.Reception_CorpseTender: A nurse is tending to the corpse of Arabella's father, one of the rejected/failed experiments of the Surgeon. She is insistent that it makes sense, even though the corpse is well... a corpse. The player can trade with this nurse.
session_synopses.ZealousAssistant_001_AD: Nurses only speak if the Surgeon is dead.Case #1 They operated on the Surgeon and killed him.Case #2.The player killed the Surgeon and ran away. The nurses now have ADs.
session_synopses.Patient_AD: Patiens has no tongue or eyes. If you release him he produces some sounds, walks a couple of feet and dies from blood loss.
session_synopses.AD_Surgeon: Surgeon in the Hospital in the Cursed Town operates on a goblin restrained in a chair.OR comments about patients if the goblin is dead (released).
session_synopses.ZealousAssistant_000_AD: Nurses only speak if the Surgeon is dead.Case #1 They operated on the Surgeon and killed him.Case #2.The player killed the Surgeon and ran away. The nurses now have ADs.
session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_2P: VB that is played when you approach the Hospital in SCL.Version for 2 characters.

PAD.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD.text: A SelÃ»ne prayer book. Hmm, well she didn't answer any prayers from this place.

session_synopses.PAD: ShadowHeart reacting on picking up "Selune Prayer Book"Location: SCL -> Tollhouse - Seized Inventory Room.She reacts both when she picks up the book or when another character does that.

PAD_Arrested.speaker: Player
PAD_Arrested.text: Well. This is quite the mess you've gotten us into.
PAD_Arrested.context: InternalNodeContext: If the first char chose to procceed in TWN_MarchingArmy_Arrest then here the second char makes a sarcastic comments about it (like, "you really thought they wouldn't catch us")

session_synopses.PAD_Arrested: The dialog after we got arrested and thrown in Moonrise Prison / Corpse Pit. The companion (if present) is sarcastic about our previous statement (before being captured) where we said that we would be able to sneak past the army without any issues.

PAD.speaker: Astarion
PAD.text: Is that blood on the shelves? Probably cold and congealed - urgh.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Unpleasantly surprised to find a room of jars filled with blood

session_synopses.PAD: Astarion reacting on approaching Blood Bank.

PAD_DoorSpotted.speaker: Player
PAD_DoorSpotted.text: Strange - the dust on the leftmost door has been wiped clean.

session_synopses.PAD_DoorSpotted: The player discovers a door to the hideout where an Aasimar Harper had survived longer than most would in the curse.

session_synopses.AD: Just a note from a fisherman.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text: *Hauliers and merchants wanted. Sail the silvery seas! Gaze upon the Gate! No experience required.*

session_synopses.AD: "Help Wanted" poster in the Cursed Town.

AD_Caster_000_CombatStarts.speaker: Ch'r'ai Tska'an
AD_Caster_000_CombatStarts.text: W'wargaz failed to kill you. I won't make the same mistake!

PAD_RealizeGithRadarFunction.speaker: Player
PAD_RealizeGithRadarFunction.text: Gith hunters. That must be why that device sounded out.

AD_Caster_000_TakingTurn_003.speaker: Ch'r'ai Tska'an
AD_Caster_000_TakingTurn_003.text: I will take the artefact for my queen!

session_synopses.Melee_000_Dead: SwD dialog for S_TWN_VlaakithAttack_Melee_000. Players are ambushed by a group of giths sent by Vlaakith to follow up on her threats.https://larianstudios.atlassian.net/browse/GUS-210886
session_synopses.PAD_RealizeGithRadarFunction: Players realize the Gith Radar must have beeped to alert them about the incoming Gith attack.Tries to play on Laezel first if she is nearby and available.

AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_001_Combat.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_001_Combat.text: IF YOU WILL NOT GIVE, THEN I WILL TAKE!

TollhouseMaster.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster.text: YOU BROUGHT VIOLENCE. UNACCEPTABLE. BUT ALL CAN BE FORGIVEN. FOR THE RIGHT PRICE.
TollhouseMaster.context: NodeContext: howling with anger on first phrases - more reasonable on last two phrases, hoping to get some cash out of the situation

TollhouseMaster.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spotting you, Gerringothe lurches forward.NodeContext: a desperate, cacophonous howl

PAD_CormyrCrate.speaker: Player
PAD_CormyrCrate.text: Silks from Cormyr, it says. Empty, though.

AD_SafeSkeleton.speaker: Narrator
AD_SafeSkeleton.text: *A forgotten soul, trapped in a safe - but who put them there, and why?*

PAD_DalelandsCrate.speaker: Player
PAD_DalelandsCrate.text: Cheese from the Dalelands. Or what's left of it.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: They gave me what they had. Should I have let them leave?

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Yes. But I guess you didn't.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: No. I thought there might be more to take. Hidden inside.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: I opened them. Searched inside them.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Why would you do something like that?

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: Some wouldn't pay their dues. Some couldn't.
Face_Guilt.context: NodeContext: Rising disgust with each sentence - but a twinge of malice with the last few words

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: They paid a different price in the end.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Perhaps you'd feel less guilty if you paid for your crimes too.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: Yes, yes. I have gold. So much gold. Take it.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: Take it all, whatever the cost.

PAD_TollmasterDead.speaker: Player
PAD_TollmasterDead.text: Free from the curse, now - perhaps she'll find peace.

AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_005_Combat.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_005_Combat.text: NO MORE TAKING. GIVE. GIVE. GIVE!

PAD_ThayCrate.speaker: Player
PAD_ThayCrate.text: All the way from Thay. Jewels and gems, probably - one's still in there.

PAD_Entrance_1P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P.text: Crates and caravans. Must be where tolls were collected.

Face_Heartlessness.speaker: Visage of Heartlessness
Face_Heartlessness.text: You'll find much of sentimental value among the confiscated goods. That is to say - junk.
Face_Heartlessness.context: InternalNodeContext: The visage is disgusted at how little people had. Full poverty-shaming (because it wanted more.)

PAD_BlockedDoor.speaker: Player
PAD_BlockedDoor.text: Forget it - it's blocked from behind.

Face_Greed.speaker: Visage of Greed
Face_Greed.text: Leave it. LEAVE IT. It's MINE.

session_synopses.TollhouseMaster: Dialogue with the Toll collector.She will continuously, endlessly demand gold from the player. You can convince her to let you pass (hard persuade), or you will have to fight  (once you stop giving it gold, or once you run out of gold).
session_synopses.AD_Face_Regret: The Visage of Regret is standing near a window that is looking at the harbor and regreting about not leaving this town.Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflectoin. Regret, in this case.
session_synopses.PAD_CormyrCrate: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Cormyr.
session_synopses.AD_TollhouseMaster: Tollhouse, Tollhouse Collector as she's hanging around by herself.
session_synopses.AD_SafeSkeleton: Player clicks on the skeleton that locked himself in the heavy safe in Tollhouse. This was am employee of Tollhouse and this way he hoped to wait out the fallout of Shadowcurse. But have died in that safe in dramatic way.
session_synopses.AD_Face_Cowardice: The Visage of Cowardice is hiding in the secret lair, hoping that nobody will find it. Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflectoin. Cowardice, in this case.
session_synopses.PAD_DalelandsCrate: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Dalelands.
session_synopses.Face_Guilt: The Visage of Guilt, hovering in front of several skeletons (dead adventurers that found their end by the hands of the Tollhouse Collector).
session_synopses.PAD_TollmasterDead: In Town in Act 2 we meet the Tollmaster that went crazy about gold
session_synopses.AD_ConfiscatedItemsPlaque: Plaque in the Tollhouse, outside a room full of confiscated items.
session_synopses.PAD_ThayCrate: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Thay.
session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_1P: VB that is played when you approach the Tollhouse in SCL
session_synopses.Face_Heartlessness: The Visage of Heartlesness is standing near some shelves with goods that it took from people.
session_synopses.PAD_BlockedDoor: PAD, happens when you click on a door in the tollhouse that is blocked from the other side.
session_synopses.Face_Greed: This Visage of Greed is standing in front of a room full of items it confiscated that became inaccessible once the shadows and vines moved in and blocked the room off.

SharAltar.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands before an altar of shar. Resting upon it is an ornate dagger.

SharAltar.speaker: Narrator
SharAltar.text: *An altar to Shar. It appears to seek pray, and a blood offering - your blood.*

SharAltar.speaker: Player
SharAltar.text: Take up the dagger, recite Shar's wisdom and offer blood from your arm.

SharAltar.context: CinematicNodeContext: With the ritual dagger in their right hand, the player quickly sliced their left palm, wincing in pain.InternalNodeContext: Rewards will appear on two pedestals in gameplay following this node.

session_synopses.SharAltar: Altar dedicated to Shar. Has a ritual dagger on it. The altar appears when you activate three tapestries with dogmas of Shar.When the altar appears the door that leads outside gets locked. You need to recite the dogmas at the altar and spill your blood on it to open the door.If you a follower of shar you can do it with not issue and get a blessing.If you aren't a follower of shar, but you passed all the saving throws you can also get a blessing of shar by reciting the dogmas.If you didn't pass all the saving throws and perform a ritual then the guardians appear because you aren't worthy.If you desecrate the altar by taking the dagger then the guardians appear no matter who you are.
session_synopses.Plaque_002_AD: One of the plaque in the Central Square.You need to click on the 3 plaques in a correct sequence to unlock a secret entrance to the secret room underneath the central square.The correct sequence: 2-3-1The plaques should either tell the history of Ketheric Thorm / this outpost or be some sort of propaganda.
session_synopses.Plaque_003_AD: One of the plaque in the Central Square.You need to click on the 3 plaques in a correct sequence to unlock a secret entrance to the secret room underneath the central square.The correct sequence: 2-3-1The plaques should either tell the history of Ketheric Thorm / this outpost or be some sort of propaganda.

ZombieArabella_Dead.speaker: Narrator
ZombieArabella_Dead.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

session_synopses.ZombieArabella_Dead: Arabella has been found dead. This means player refused to find her parents earlier, and she then ran off.

PAD_Entrance_2P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_2P.text: See that symbol on the ground? This was a masons' guild.

PAD_Entrance_2P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_2P.text: That explains the unfinished statues. The impaled skeletons, not so much.

session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_2P: VB that is played when you approach the Mason's Guild in SCL.Version for 2 characters.

LeavingAct.speaker: Narrator
LeavingAct.text: *The curse has been lifted, the lands cleansed of the shadows. Ketheric's reign of living death is over.*
LeavingAct.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players leave SCL by the Risen Road. They look back to see beams of light breaking through the clouds.-The curse has been lifted. The clouds above part, and a powerful beam of moonlight shines through and illuminates the town centre where the statue of Ketheric stood. It is now shattered.

LeavingAct.speaker: Narrator
LeavingAct.text: *Your courage has been tested, and in this, at least, you have triumphed.*
LeavingAct.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cut to close up of the shattered statue. An enormous silver tree bursts through the ground where the statue once stood, silver leaves/fruits sprouting, and the light from above intensifies as the shadows disperse.

CinematicNodeContext: Cut back to party, with Halsin in shot, looking across the rejuvenating region. Halsin takes front and centre, looking back across the 'healed'vista, overjoyed, and then the party turn and continue their journey

PAD_ArmyLeft.speaker: Player
PAD_ArmyLeft.text: The Absolute's armies are on the march - and Baldur's Gate is their target.

session_synopses.LeavingAct: Scene of players leaving SCL to travel to Intermezzo. This scene triggers when the party leave Moonrise Tower after defeating Ketheric. There are two variants. One where the curse has been lifted, one where the curse hasn't been lifted.If the curse has been lifted, Halsin and/or Art Cullagh will be present at Moonrise if alive, and will tell players that the quest has succeeded, and that when they leave Moonrise, they'll see the restults. They tell you to wrap up your business here first. This happens in the dialogues for those characters, not here.If the curse hasn't been lifted, players see a vista of the shadow-cursed lands on leaving Moonrise, and move on toward the Risen Road.
session_synopses.PAD_ArmyLeft: Comment on how the absolute army left. Reactivity if you saw them previously or not.

AD_FakeMasonBones.speaker: Narrator
AD_FakeMasonBones.text: *These bones appear to have come from a collection of different skeletons.*

session_synopses.AD_FakeMasonBones: | In SCL - TOWN - Masonry there is a pile of crashed bones on display. The plaque nearby suggests these are the bones of the head Mason who had conspiracy agains Sharrans. Player can spot here that something is off with these bones - like the skeletons contains bones of different people |
